When you live in an apartment, or have need supplemental heat during the winter, this little device is for you.  The lint trap is designed to catch any excess lint coming out of the dryer and disperse heat throughout the room from the dryer.  As my dryer is not vented to the outside, this was an absolute MUST for me.  I love it!
summary: A must have for apartment dwellers or anyone whose dryer does not vent to the outside!

I have it sitting on the floor next to dryer. The zip ties are also total crap and do not secure the hose to the dryer or lint trap. I had to use zip ties. I'm not returning it because I need it for now but I'd recommend a different lint trap if you need one of these type products due to no exterior vent.

reviewText: Very flimsy attachments, difficult to attach without coming off
Cheap, already broke

Had this item for about 4 years.  Every winter we connect it to the dryer duct to re-direct the dryer heat inside.  Our dryer is in the mud room of the first floor and there is some moisture condensation for the beginning of the cycle but the dampness is useful to counter balance the dryness from the forced hot air from our home's heat pump.  We make sure the connections are secure because sometimes extra lint or dust can escape.  Also, we use an old pantyhose around the box as another filter to catch more lint.

We did not have a dryer vent in our new condo. Wish I had noticed that before we moved in. This seemed to be the only option and it is barely adequate. It does catch a lot of the lint but fine particles seem to escape at will. We have to dust the condo after every wash day. I didn't see any better options out there.

By the way, it is cheaply made, be gentle with it or you will mess it up.

*****Update****

After using this thing for about 9 months we have decided to stop using our dryer in the condo. I changed it from 3 stars to 1. It just doesn't catch enough lint and when we did a spring cleaning by moving furniture and the washer / dryer to clean up dust bunnies it was obvious it does a very poor job of eliminating lint from escaping into the rest of our condo. It was gross, and to think we've been breathing that stuff in. And, yes, we followed instructions, made sure there was plenty of water in the basin and we cleaned it out each time we used it. I do not recommend this product. We prefer going to the laundry building in our complex rather than use the dryer with the lint catcher.
summary: No longer using it, it just doesn't do the job

I'd order this again and recommend it highly.

reviewText: I have had other digital devices that disappointed me.  This machine has been the most accurate and responsive to the sensing and display of changing humidity and temperature. Started up without failure and hasn't failed yet (1-1/2 months). Good purchase.

Works well, easy to read and reasonably priced. Our home humidifier does not have a digital display. This monitor gives a very accurate sense of how well it is working. I would buy it again.
Use these throughout the house in winter.  We burn wood via woodstove so house gets really dry.  This lets us know just how dry the house is to increase the humidity as needed.

Six years ago, when we purchased our GE Monogram compactor, it came with bags. They were very thick, the bottoms were pleated for perfect fit and they had holes for the "buttons" on the sides to keep the bags from sliding when compacting. For a couple of years, we could purchase similar bags from GE, but they were pretty costly for such an item. What has happened, GE? Thinner bags, flat, with no holes. It was a lot of work to make the bag fit--well, almost fit. Half the price, I have to admit, but then, you get what you pay for. I am tempted to order directly from GE and see if there is a difference. I am wondering if GE provides these bags of poorer quality so they can be sold cheaper. (I used amazon, because it was easy. The bags came quickly, no complaint there.)

reviewText: Let me preface this review by stating I did not use the product after I read the label.  My rating is based on what I read and concerns raised by what was and wasn't stated.  After reading one review that mentioned the ingredients weren't listed I was curious and pulled out a magnifying glass to read the fine print before using. :The label says "NOTICE: Since the use of this product is beyond the control of the seller, liability or damages, either incidental or consequential, shall be limited to replacement of the product."  It states to wear protective eyewear, protective clothing and gloves.  Don't get in eyes, on skin or clothing and directions for what to do if you do.  There is also a statement that says hazardous to humans/domestic animals.  Granted all these admonitions are for the undiluted product. Having read all of this, all I could think was, if this is in my cool mist humidifier which is 2 feet from my head, I am breathing in whatever this is. I am glad that I only paid $6 for this because I will not use it.

Not much to say about this replacement water panel.  This was an easy job.  Open the door on the humidifier. Disconnect the water line - just pull it off, it's a rubber hose and is held on by friction.  Pull out the the old panel and holder  Remove the the original water panel from the holder.  Put the replacement panel into the panel holder and reinstall in humidifier.  Reconnect water hose, close humidifier door and you're good to go.  Took longer to write this then to perform the task.  The replacement panel comes with good instructions.

This works about the same as most sold by other humidifier companies to clean them, but no better really. I have found the best is white or distilled vinegar with peroxide but please do not stand over or have your eyes close to the fumes from this combination as it can be long term harmful to vision according to studies done on these products. As long as you leave the room for the soak in the sink or in the product base, and then come to rinse it in plain water, that has come to be my favorite combination for cleaning and descaling. Not straight vinegar and peroxide but mixed in water, like gallon of water, cup of vinegar, half or quarter cup of peroxide. This also will kill any mold or mildew that might have developed.
Arizona water is half copper and arsenic. Kidding but not really - this filter saves your humidifier from total Clog City.
summary: A good investment in respiratory health.

reviewText: I'm giving this only three stars mostly based on that it's not returnable and the Waste King  (L2600) I bought came with a plug and I thought it did not. Also this does not have a rubber lip to seal the sink like the Waste King OEM one does.

Worst purchase ever.  Literally I curse this drain cover every day.

It covers the garbage disposal drain very well. Too well in fact.  EVERYTHING sits on top of it.  So I have to shove everything down manually.  It's ridiculous.  Even the smallest bits of food get stuck on top of it and clog up the sink.  So I have to reach my hand down there to shove stuff down.  And it's not just a one time push, it takes several attempts.

The plastic is too hard so it doesn't flex to let anything down the drain.  I even cut it to make the hole a little bigger but all food still sits on top.

So if you want a disposal drain cover that doesn't let anything down the drain.  Buy this.  If you are SUPER green and want something to force you to compost even the smallest bit of food. Buy this.  If you want to swear at a $3 piece of plastic daily.  But this.

But if you want most things to go down into your disposal so it can do it's job. Look elsewhere.

By the way, my wife said "Really?  You're making time to write a review about that stupid cheap drain cover?".  Yes.  If I save just one person from the mental aggravation of this purchase I will have lived a meaningful life.

If you are looking for a large compactor bag to fit an 18" compactor such as the Electrolux IKON, the Whirlpool W10165296RP IS NOT a substitute for the Kitchenaid 18" 4318938 bag.  Evidently the Kitchenaid product is no longer available and the Whirlpool bag is substituted (by all vendors I believe).  The Whirlpool 18" bag is smaller than the Kitchenaid and is NOT an adequate substitute as it does not fit compactors such as the Electrolux (whereas the Kitchenaid bag did).  So, bear that in mind if you are actually trying to buy the Kitchenaid bag.
summary: Kitchenaid 4318938 NOT SAME as Whirlpool W10165296RP

reviewText: They don't work well for my Viking compactor (viking was out of stock for 5 weeks).  These fit but don't hold well.

I was skeptical about buying a wireless switch for my disposal but as I didn't want to drill in an air switch and I didn't want to add another switch in my wall/back splash with the price so low I gave it a go.  This item works great.  Range is not a problem as some suggested.  It plugs into a standard outlet in the bottom socket with no problem and leaves enough room above to get my dishwasher plugged into the top socket without issue.  The remote comes with a holster for wall mounting if you desire.  After installing it my wife actually prefers it to our old dishwasher with a switch on the wall.  You don't have to touch an electric switch with wet hands and make a mess of a wall socket.  If you want to keep this switch super clean just put it in a zip-lock bag.

Remember to buy the remote batteries separately as they are not easy to find locally but Amazon has them without issue.  I don't know that I would stick my hand down the disposal with a remote controlled switch without first unplugging but that is good practice regardless.  There is a switch on the socket for always on or you simply use the remote to power off and on.  I am sure it would also be great for other remote control electrical uses such as lights (possibly outside) or other appliances.  We simply love ours and are glad we gave it a try.

We have found it to be safe and reliable.
summary: GREAT UNIT TO AVOID ADDITIONAL DISHWASHER ELECTRICAL WIRING

reviewText: I'm one of those people who has a perpetual burn on her arm from reaching into the oven, so buying this item was a no-brainer for me. First, installation: the snaps are not at the perfect distance apart for my particular oven racks, so I had to stretch the product a bit in one place and wrinkle it in another so the snaps would clear the bars. It isn't very stretchable, but the bars are so thin, I didn't really have a problem with adjusting it. Second, the smell: On my first use, I had the oven at 475 degrees F. (the max is 500). The product gave off a strong chemical smell. I haven't used the oven a second time since then, so I don't know if the smell will linger. Third, the product isn't long enough to stretch the entire length of the oven racks, so there's a couple of inches that are bare on either end if you center it. Not really a problem unless you're reaching into that extreme edge of the oven. Overall I'm happy with this product and would purchase it again.
summary: Good quality item and works as described

reviewText: I purchased this item as a combination drinking water and icemaker filter (as advertised).  I uninstalled it later the same day on which I installed it.  It may be okay for an icemaker but it is a terrible item to use for drinking water.  The flow rate on my drinking tap was decreased by about 90%.  It takes forever to fill a 1 gallon jug.  I also bought an extra filter thinking this was a good solution based upon the reviews I read.  It's in the garbage now (the day after the install/uninstall).
I had just purchased an ice maker for my refrigerator and needed to get the chlorine taste out of our water. This item took about 15 minutes to install and now "no more chlorine:

I've used this filter for about 18 months and really like it. Installation was simple and changing filter cartridges is a snap. Water is crystal clear and tastes good. Best thing is the low cost compared to those I've used previously. Waaaaay less!  I think the Culligan EZ Change is a great system and a real bargain.

After a little more use and having water sit in the hose, I can say that this hose give the water an intolerable taste.  Do not attempt to use for drinking water.

Post hook up to fridge,  I ran 3 tubs full of ice and then replaced the newly installed water filter with a brand new filter with no improvement in the taste.  It's been some time now and the water and ice still have a rubber/garden hose taste.  I'm going to give it another week or two but I think I'm going to switch to copper so I can use the water and ice.

WASTE OF MONEY!

this thing looks as though they took the left over scraps from the scouring pads and packed it loosely in a wire frame.

I went to my son's house and was talking about how our stove vent went on the blink. He said his did the same thing.  I walked over to the stove looked it over.  I ordered this for my stove hood, thinking how great it would be when it was going to be fixed.  When this arrived in the mail I was going to slip it in the slot and run the exhaust vent When I turned it on the exhaust fan had completely quit.  Plus it was the wrong size but fit his vent space perfectly.  So there you have it!  Hidden memory.  He now has a new vent filter and the stove hood runs perfectly at his house. As for ours the whole stove hood has to be replaced.  At least something got fixed.

The filter material is so thin I can see right through it.  It does nothing to stop cooking oils and steam from going right through.  After cooking some pork chops I found an oily residue on the top of the hood (vent exhaust) and on the cabinets right above the vents.  I never had that until I installed this flimsy thing.

The OEM filter I was looking to replace was heavy and sturdy with several thick layers of black material on one side and green on the other.  I will order a replacement directly from the manufacturer.
summary: Not an effective range hood filter

We were awakened during the night by squealing from our refrig/freezer.  Doing some troubleshooting, we discovered the evaporator fan was in trouble.  My first thought was...check out Amazon!  For less than $16.00 we were able to fix the problem and save a bundle.  We could have had an enormous bill if we had called a plumber/electrician to drive 25 miles one way, declare we needed an evaporator fan, drive back to town, order the part, return and replace part, drive back to town.  Imagine the mileage costs alone. I think we would have paid more than 16.00 for the part too and with Amazon Prime, no postage and we had the part in two days. Amazon is a real "go to" place.

reviewText: Bought and had it shipped to Hawaii.  Takes about 15 minutes to make a batch of Large ice 'cubes', shaped more like thimbles to be honest. For years my ice maker has produced mostly shattered ice cubes, finding a solid cube was rare. In the last few months I also started to have major problems with the ice maker overflowing and freezing up. I probably pulled the whole ice maker and bucket out a dozen times to let it completly defrost after it had overflowed and formed a giant ice glob.

I finally got tired of dealing with this and was about to buy a replacement ice maker when stumbling across this part. I didn't think the tray alone could be causing the problems I was having but after reading another review with similar problems I decided to give it a shot before ordering a whole new unit.

The new tray looked exactly like the old except for a shine on the new one indicating a much smoother surface. Overtime the surface of the old tray had worn and become rough enough that the ice was sticking to it instead of breaking out cleanly. When dumping ice into the bucket this caused the ice to shatter and leave chunks stuck to the tray which eventually caused overflows.

For the first time in years I have a ice bucket full of solid ice cubes instead of shattered pieces! I had no idea the tray would make such a big difference! If you are having any problems like this I highly recommend trying a replacement tray.
Perfect fit. Easy to install when the original cracked.

reviewText: If you are a little handy, and you like youtube, this can save you a lot of money.

I originally came across this stuff a couple decades ago when I was preparing to hike into the Grand Canyon, back then it went under the name "Gookinaid ERG". The stuff kept me alive & well hydrated throughout my trek, and I'm happy to say it still the "best thing since sliced bread" when it comes to long summer days working outside.  No artificial colors or flavors, less sugar and more potassium than other more heavily advertised sport drinks.

first thing first: it works. the kit is great in what it consists of and the price is just right i think. to call someone to clean my dryer vents i got quoted from 80 all the way up to 200 bucks. so if you were able to do it yourself you will need to invest a bit more in a "construction" vacuum that cost about 80-100 bucks and start the savings basically from the second time you do it.

so whats with the 3*? my brush broke inside my vent!!!! while i was pulling it out, and yes i was using a drill, all the pieces came out except the round brush. i had to climb to my attic and push it from the other side to come out... what was supposed to be an easy task ended up with me spending over an hour extra in climbing in my attic, disassembling the HVAC pipe so that i can get in there and push down on the brush...

another minus for this kit is that while it is fairly bendy, it will not go very smoothly through your flexible insulated pipes and most likely push the pipe out from its connector.

with all that said, if your vent duct doesnt have to many bends, and you want to take the risk (maybe i had a defective kit that the brush broke), you might save a lot of money doing it yourself!

reviewText:
If you need a quiet ice machine, look elsewhere. This one is LOUD - and not just the ice dropping - its a freezer so it runs all day long - if your installation will be in an area that needs quiet, this will not work.  If you can't deal with defrosting the freezer once per month, look elsewhere.  Defrosting is as simple as dumping the ice and turning the unit off for an hour (simple).  If you can't find the energy to break up some ice that's still connected, look elsewhere.  However, if you are like me and just need to produce more ice to keep up with the demand of a family on the move, this is a great choice.  If you are on a budget, this is a great choice.
An ice maker that's quiet, makes perfect ice and doesn't need defrosted will cost you five times as much to buy and another couple hundred dollars to have the pluming work done.
This machine has it's drawbacks but for the price I am more than happy with the purchase.  I love the fact that I didn't need a drain and I love the price point.
If you are concerned about a "cheap" brand, you can buy a three-year extended warranty when you purchase through Amazon for $30.00 to give you more confidence in the decision.
summary: It's not perfect but perfect for the right buyer

reviewText: Super easy to use, cleans laundry shockingly good! This is a must have for long camping trips, or if you just have a few delicate items that you don't want to use a washing machine for. Ive washed my cloth diapers in mine and they came out spotless!
Even my kids like to wash their clothes, thank you..

This thing sure does leak like crazy. At first I tried it on my kitchen counter top, but that made a big wet mess. It was leaking out the bottom, the sides, and the top. (I figured a way to put the lid on to prevent it from leaking out the top, but it still leaks from the sides and bottom.)

The second time I used this, I put it in the bathtub instead. It still leaks, but now it doesn't matter.

I read nearly all the reviews before deciding to purchase this. My goal was to have a way to hand wash delicates like bras and wool sweaters. Currently I do those items in a big bucket, but they never seem to come out clean. The armpits of my bras are especially hard to clean and there is often deodorant and sweat build up in them.

I knew to expect that this would be a somewhat flimsy device that leaked, and that's exactly how I experienced the Wonderwash. Still, it was fast and effective. My bras came out cleaner than any time I ever hand washed them, and the overall effort to get them clean was less. I particularly like the way the water drains out the bottom rather than me needing to fish my bras out of a bucket of water.

I doubt I would enjoy using this as my *only* form of clothes washer, but as a way to handwash delicate items I am quite satisfied with it. Four stars because it does what I need it to at a very low price point but leaks a lot in the process.
summary: Leaks a bunch, but gets the job done

First of all, I would probably have given it 5 stars if pieces didn't keep falling off, but the thing does seem a little cheaply made. However, the pieces that do fall off don't affect the actual functionality of the product. The other downfall is the suction cups on the bottom are often very difficult to get to adhere to a surface, but again, that doesn't really impact it's functioning properly. I needed something to supplement my trips to the laundromat, and it has worked well for that purpose. I have also found it's a better way of doing my hand washables versus the sink. It works best in a stand up shower so that you can drain and rinse in the same spot. Trying to carry the tub when it's full is heavy and awkward. I tried it in the bathroom with the bath tub, but your back will hate you by the time your done, so I don't recommend using it where there is a ledge that you will have to bend over to use it. Also, go light on the soap or you will be rinsing forever to get it all out. All in all though, it's a nifty contraption that supplements nicely, and your bicep will get a nice little workout! It has saved me when my son tells me the night before that he needs something cleaned-and it's simple enough that I can make him clean it!
summary: Great product for supplementing trips to the laundromat!

reviewText: Can't wait for summer to go camping and try this out.  Had to try already and it works great.  will make a great addition to my camping supplies

this is not a family washing machine unless you enjoy slaving away at your laundry but i do have alot of nice dress clothes seeing as that's all i literally wear. this machine allows me to take the time to spot treat all my shirts and pants. i am able to ensure every load (6 shirts or 3 pants) is as closely matched color wise as possible which keeps everything brighter and untainted by like but offish colors. i even gentle wash (slow easy cranks) my polyester ties in it!!! you should definitely allow gentle loads to pre soak to minimize the spinning i feel it will prolong the life of my ties doing so. also being winter i just put my wrung out clothes on a rack in front of my heater for free drying!

perfect for a bachelor/bachelorette that doesn't like wasting water, electricity and space. the only con i would say is time consumption.

We got this because the washer quit right before the holidays and we wanted to wait and buy a replacement washing machiune when appliances went on sale.  Now that I have this, I will never buy another washing machine.  Love it.

- I recommend putting it up on a counter, workbench, etc.  Ours is on our head washing machine.  I think putting it down in the bathtub is awkward.

- I also recommend filling it with a hose instead of trying to hold the tub under a faucet.  I disconnected the water hoses to our dead washer and use those.

-- Some people dump the tub over because they don't like to wait for the Wonderwash to drain on its own.  I use the drain pipe and let it fall into the utility sink.  I think I will switch to a five-gallon bucket at some point and use the gray water outdoors for gardening or landscape plants.

-- The clothes look better than they did using the regular washer.  I think the compression pushes out the dinge by percolating out the old detergent from previous washes.

-- I bought a janitorial mop wringer and bucket to squeeze out the clothes.  I hang most of the wash on the basement clothesline and then do the rest in the dryer.  Some people buy a little electric spin dryer.

-- The tub holds about half of the normal load I use to put in.  It takes less time to do each load, though.  I can put both the top and bottom queen-size bedsheets in and then do the pillowcases with the towels.  If I was doing king size sheets, I'd just do the top and bottom sheets separately.  I do one or two tubfuls of laundry daily and our clothes hamper is usually empty for the first time in my life.

-- I timed out the spins and for a normal load, I spin the washing tub moderately slow 30 times in each direction.  If the clothes are very dirty I do double the number of spins.  To rinse, I can do more like 15 or 20 spins each way.

-- The stand has suction cups on the bottom but I put mine on an old bath towel as I splash a bit as I pull out wet clothes.

-- It was easy to assemble it.  Five minutes tops.

-- I use a fourth of the detergent I used to use, and much less water.  The dryer runs a bit longer as the towels and jeans don't spin dry but I hang most of my stuff on the line so I use the same amount of electricity to run the dryer or maybe a little less.

-- The shipping speed was fantastic.  I think I got it the day after I ordered it.

*** UPDATE: The Wonder Wash lasted over a year, with a lot of use. I literally used it every day. One day the glue quit on the axle peg which holds the tub to the supporting frame. I tried to repair it, but couldn't figure out a solution. I have now switched to a plastic laundry plunger.  I got my money's worth out of the Wonder Wash, and it got me started with doing my laundry without a machine. I am glad I bought it. Here is more about my laundry switchover process: http://mgseltzer.hubpages.com/hub/I-Never-Replaced-Our-Washing-Machine-Part-One
summary: Bought as a stopgap, used it for over a year.

reviewText: I live full time in an RV, and have had to go 3 weeks without doing laundry. This helps! You can do maybe 1 1/2 outfits, like 1 pair of jeans, 2 tee shirts, 5 underwear, etc. One thing, it doesn't spin dry, you gotta ring stuff out, so I wouldn't do sheets or towels. It seemed shaky at first, but it's sturdy and holding up. I am growing to like the Wonder Washer, I keep it in the shower, and have been using it once or twice a week.

i like the product because i'm off grid and it takes 15 gallons of water to run a washing machine, so i sold mine as i harvest rainwater and its just not feasible . i don't use wonderwash for everything, but i like that i could if i had too. i'm in a hurricain zone as well and for that reason alone its worth it. it works alright, spins easily the more water u add, the easier it spins. but really its not a washing machine and you do have to rinse with more water added by hand, and you do have to ring all the clothes out, it does not spin them dry for you- i'm working on that myself , i still need a way to rung them out- that would be my only complaint with this product, but i knew that when i bought it. i will be checking into rungers now
It is not very stable jumps around alot needs better or more supportive base, but I think it cleans better than a commercial washer

As a single mom on a super tight budget, I bought this washer to save money. We live in an apartment with a laundry facility that charges $1.50 per wash and $1.25 per dryer cycle, so I have been spending about $30-40 each month to do laundry. Since I am home a lot, the Wonderwash fits perfectly into my lifestyle. I can throw a batch of clothes in, sit by the tub and crank the washer for a few mins while my toddler sits on the potty. Then I take the lid off, attach the drain spout, and come back in 10 mins to add water to rinse. I've been soaking heavily soiled or stinky things overnight in the Wonderwash, rinsing them in the morning, then hanging everything on a standing clothes drying rack that fits perfectly in my tub. It only takes a couple minutes to rinse and hang things up.

I don't mind hanging things to dry, since I realize I mostly used the laundry facility's dryer because I couldn't really carry a whole basket of wet laundry back to my apartment.

The Wonderwash is light enough that even with a full load, I can lift it out of the tub and set it on the floor if I need to take a shower while something is still in the washer. It is so nice to be able to do it all in my apartment w/o leaving my toddler alone. It's especially great for washing things that need immediate attention to prevent a stain from setting, and I don't feel wasteful for not waiting for enough dirty laundry to pile up to make a full load. The $48 + shipping I paid for this is easily going to save me hundreds of dollars a year.

I would have given this 5 stars if there were a spin cycle attribute. It seems like there should be some way to make it drain water by cranking it the same way to make the water spin out. It would have to have an internal way to collect the water so it didn't spray everywhere. I'm sure something like that could be designed without making it much heavier.
summary: As a single mom on a tight budget...

This was such a great purchase. My husband and I are working on our home bar and this fit in their great!  This is NOT an under the counter bar. This was fine for our needs because the back wall of our bar opens to another room so there is plenty of air flow. It fits an insane amount of refrigerated beverages in it as well. Our set up right now is the small shelf on top where our fruit containers go, one large shelf that fits about 30 bottles of beer, and then the bottom open which fits six juice containers, a few cans of pop, a couple of bottles of wine and then some. We keep a large cooler for overfill but this thing holds a TON.

Overall I"ve been very pleased with this refrigerator. It looks great and has been very useful. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the door doesn't close and seal as well as I would like. I have to shut the door slowly to make sure that it is actually closed. There are not very good adjustment knobs on the bottom front, so I've had to prop it up to get a slight backward tilt to help it stay shut. I also wish it would stay just a tad colder. Overall, I would recommend this product.

Update: 08/01/16 I ended up returning the original unit and had another sent out to me, but the same problem occurred. This would not reached the stated 43 degrees in the specs. I'm not sure what you would use this "cooler" for, but it does not cut it for making drinks cold. I am returning the second unit. I would have liked to try another manufacturer on Amazon, but there simply was not another comparable product to try in the price range. 2 stars now for looks and the locking feature.

Does not get cold enough for me. Saw another review that stated they have it set to 36F, not sure how that's possible when the manufacturers sated range is from 43-57f. I have a digital  thermometer inside the fridge and my range goes from 47-50 at the lowest temperature setting on the dial. I like my beverages cold, and beer snobs aside, it just doesn't cut it getting cold enough.

No manual received,  fridge has led light that doesn't work at all. The customer service with Danby is horrible. Better to purchase in store for easy return in case it's damaged. Target sells this fridge. It's a very nice looking piece, better with working light.

The fridge works well for cooking drinks, etc but the shipping damaged the mechanism that triggers the light. The door is also loose and easily is left open. Not sure if this is just the fridge or if it was also from the shipping. I am disappointed and should have returned when I realized it was damaged but just couldn't find the time.
We just took refrigerator out of box, and the light doesn't work and its loud.
holds so much!
Husband loves the fridge. Great price!!!
Works great so far, looks real good
Exactly as described!

It looks good, seems to work fine.  I ended up taking out a shelf because I want to store beer bottles, ended up working fine for box wine at the top, a bunch of beer bottles in the middle, and some sodas in the small bottom area.  I kind of duck a bomber or two by the box wines, not enough space for them to stand anywhere.  I also got a thermometer, a dial style, that i ended up mounting to the glass with some Sugru.  This keeps it out of the way of the bottles, and allows for fine temperature control.

However, the shelves don't do a great job holding the bottles upright.  I will probably get or make some sort of organizer.
summary: Good looking, seems to work well.

reviewText: We bought this for our President's office.  It hummed and vibrated so loudly you could hear it all the way down the hallway.  Definitely going back.
summary: We bought this for our President's office. It hummed ...

reviewText: love it, now my beer doesn't take up all my main fridge!

The fridge itself works just fine.  The main issue (and only issue) is the shelves.  The distance between the rails is too wide which causes cans of soda to tilt to one side.  Another reviewer has posted a good photo showing this issue.  I strongly recommend you look at those photos to see the issue before buying.  That aside, the fridge does work well without issues, but the shelves suck.
summary: The fridge itself works just fine. The main issue (and only issue) is the ...

reviewText: It works but doesn't keep beers super cold - also a little noisy.  The door gets condensation inside - not sure if that means that its not sealing properly.

Its like a kitchen cabinet for beer. Not soda - just beer. The advertised picture shows Diet Cokes, Pepsi and Red Bull..... Well I hide that junk in the big fridge with stainless doors so it can't be seen.  The beers however I proudly display in the Danby DBC120BLS BEVERAGE CENTER. So sexy! Every time I wander into the kitchen BAM there's cold beers staring at me through the glass like a puppy in a pet store. (puppies only cats are like sodas keep them behind the stainless). Cats suck.....kittens too.

A little tip for you inexperienced  folks, start your beer drinking from the bottom shelf. It will be easier to grab from the higher shelves as the beers side effects kick in.

Another tip: (This is only necessary if beer is stocked)... get some of those stickers that old people put on glass doors to keep them from walking face first into it.  Some friends and folk that stop by for a cold one will freak the ?%** out when they see this Danby DBC120BLS BEVERAGE CENTER stocked with some of daddy's sweet sauce in a can, they may damage their wrist,  or possibly their face reaching for a can. I suggest stickers of the dragonfly because dragonflies are badass. NOT as badass as puppies but badass nonetheless.

Last tip: Buy this fridge. I got this machine on sale for 199. free shipping. I researched it one week and the next week the clever individuals at Amazon sent me an email showing it on sale. Clever bastards.

Cheers !!

Ive been running the Beverage Center for about a week now and have no significant complaints.  Its quiet, nice looking, and can chill at least 3 cases of beer down to the mid-30s (F).  The door lock is especially nice for me as a father of teenagers.  Im running it on a counter top and haven't noticed any water on or around the unit yet.

My only (minor) gripe is that the wire spacing on the shelves could be a little closer; sometimes cans will not stand straight if positioned too far to the left or right of a wire.  This is resolved easily enough by just using a piece of cardboard as a shelf liner.

The fridge came well packed but overall it just looks cheap.
Yes it has an internal fan that circulates the air but in my case the thermostat does nothing, all the way on one end the fridge shuts off, anywhere else it's 50 deg F. Glad i bought the service plan.
I replaced the internal bulb with an LED one (the feit candelabra ones work) but i had to remove the transparent cover and trim a little bit of the bulb enclosure at the opposite end from the socket. Looks much nicer now.

One more thing about this fridge is that the condenser on it si built into the sides, not in the rear. So don't mount this flush on the sides with furniture or other appliances because it won't be able to do it's job.

Overall it does work but i feel like i could have done better looking locally.
Bought in June2013 and love it. It keeps drinks cold and we haven't had a problem from it at all.  It isn't loud either.  Love that I can lock it to keep the kids out. of it.
Nice, but doesn't really get that cold and kind of loud. Buy something else if you want you beverages really cold and its in a part of the house the noise is a concern...
Its definitely not a floor fridge, you need a good sturdy base to put it on, but other then that it is spacious and works really well.
No complaints at all, works as I thought it would. Just make sure the door is closed when you leave, it you shut it hard the door can bounce back open.

Ok, so I bought this unit at a GREAT price on Amazon.com.  I guess it must have been on sale, but I didn't notice until a few days after I ordered how good of a price I really got.

I was kind of afraid to order, as there are a lot of reviews on here that says they had shipping damage.  Well, I decided to go for it, and guess what.....I too had shipping damage.  The top left corner of the door and the unit was bashed in.  The unit damage I didn't care too much about, as it is under my bar and you can't see it, but the door was a huge eye sore.

I called Amazon about this, and recieved great customer service.  They gave me the number to Danby and said if there is anything owed, just to let them (Amazon) know and they would cover any costs.

I called Danby, and called Danby, and called Danby, and left messages.  The phone was always busy, or it was after hours.  Finally I left another message and a guy called me back.  This took about 4 days of calling.  Anyway, at first they said that they do not ship parts or doors to consumers, but then he talked to his manager, and agreed to ship a new door to me.

Door arrived pretty promptly, so thanks to Danby for that.  It also did not have the Danby sticker or the warning stickers on it....so thanks for that as well....it looks better!  Door was easy to install, and they didn't ask for the old door back.  Cool.

Now my only other issue with it, is it seems to run constantly.  At first I had it turned to MAX, and it was cold enough, but ran all the time, I tried a medium setting, and now it's just barely cold enough, but still seems to run all the time.  Is this normal?

Also, the sides stay very warm.

It is a good looking unit.
summary: Still not sure, plus shipping damage that WAS corrected

reviewText: OUR OVEN WORKS LIKE NEW!!! THANKS!!!

I bought this ignitor because I had to hit the old one with a screwdriver to get the oven to start. This one came quickly, but it is a different shape than the original one. It was a bit of a hassle removing the old bracket and jury rigging it to the new part to situate it so it would work. Once done it works great.

My oven started being finicky about heating and would make the loud "whoomp" sound as if it was filling up with too much gas before igniting it.

This new ignitor fixed it.

Based on my research, if your ignitor looks like this one then it is safe to assume it is a viable replacement.  Check them side-by-side when you receive it to make sure.

When my oven burner wouldn't light anymore I didn't some online research to determine the problem.  I quickly concluded that it was more than likely the igniter.  I then researched the model # for a replacement igniter.  The replacement igniter cost around $60 so I did some more research and determined that I could use this igniter instead and it cost a lot less. I received the igniter, installed it and everything works great.  The research I did, showed that you can typically replace square igniters with other square igniters and round igniters with other round igniters.  From my research, it appears that square igniters draw one amount of current and round igniters draw a different amount of current.  Obviously keep a close eye on the general size so that the replacement will fit in and also look at the mounting bracket to make sure it's compatible.  Very happy with my purchase.

Absolutely over priced but does its job as a lint trap. Fast shipping but really should be no more than like 15 bucks. Plastic with the mesh screen. Our last one was broken so had to replace. I found that the item listed my model number then read the listing title "Bin Door for REFRIGERATOR" and thought that it it fit the FRIG door - not the freezer.  I'll take some of the blame for not checking the inches but the title and description could be clearer.
summary: Freezer not Refrigerator Door on my model

reviewText: This filter was actually a bit too large for our humidifier (even though it was one of the ones listed as compatible). It sort of works - but once we used it, we couldn't really return it. I've trimmed it to fit, but it doesn't quite hold together the same.
They work just as well or better than the more expensive filters. I will buy them again!
after trying to soak the old one in vinegar,and everything else. we are happy to get it,perfect fit.will be ordering another for standby.
Nice item; what was needed at an equitable price

I love Sonic ice to the point where I was going to Sonicto buy bags of their ice.  I took a while to decide on this purchase because of the price.  However, I love it.  I bring ice to our friends' homes now.

Well I melted my plastic microwave cover on the previous burner. (Don't ask) But I followed the instructions and looked up the stove serial number so the selection was perfect. The item arrived bent ( I mentioned that in packaging feedback) but I was easily able to straighten it out and install it. Works like a charm and makes the other coils look pretty grimy. :-) I may replace them all so I get an all new stove. Overall very happy.
These are great quality and fit perfectly.
Fine.
It was as advertised
Exact fit. Works great
Fit, was what i needed.
Fits perfect, great product.
Perfect fit. Fast delivery

I was not sure it this would fit the dryer model that we have, since it is an older machine, but I found a site that had replacement parts listed for my machine and I compared it to this one. They were matching numbers. So I ordered it. The shape is not exact but the area that it differs is not relevant. It is a plastic mold around a wire screen. The old lint trap used a softer mesh. The felt sides that keep the lint from passing around the filter are not as thick as the original one. I would have liked them to have stuck out a little more so, to prevent lint from getting past better, but all in all the filter works fine. I am holding on to the old one for awhile...just in case.

My 2 cents: If you have never taken your dryer part and vacuumed the inside of it (the parts that you don't see) you should. There are plenty of video out there that will show you how to take apart your dryer. The lint that get past the lint trap over the years accumulates on the motor and the bottom of the dryer. Huge fire hazard. If you are too nervous to take your dryer apart and put it back together have a professional do it. Also never leave your home with the dryer running. While you are at it...your exhaust fans in your bathroom and the coils on you fridge will thank you for a good vacuum as well.
summary: It worked for our Kenmore 90 series gas dryer

reviewText: Fits very tight and not in a completely good way.
Ive only had it a few months but its super sturdy and works very well!
Fits perfect.  A bit stiffer than original filter, but I think its going to hold up better.
summary: Fits perfect. A bit stiffer than original filter

reviewText: Works perfectly. Fit right into the dryer like the original part and seems to be better built if that makes sense.
summary: Fit right into the dryer like the original part and seems to be better built ...

reviewText:
This is NOT an OEM version.
I noticed a large difference in the amount of lint this catches vs the OEM.
Beware --- this could lead to higher chance of a fire (lint in the pipes), more electricity used since the lint exhaust will be more jammed (so drying times will be longer), and harder on your dryer.
Waste of my money and I should have just bitten the bullet on a higher quality OEM one.
summary: Does not fit as well as or catch as much lint as the OEM

reviewText: No problems here, exactly as ordered.  We've been using this filter several weeks now and it's holding up to our expectations.
Value priced and amazingly easy install.  Completely Satisfied.
After trying to diagnose my refrigerator for weeks I ordered the whirlpool 100190935 motor it was the perfect fit and got to me in perfect time and it worked excellent.

The original screen that came with our dryer began separating from the frame in a matter of months so we shopped around online and decided to order this as a replacement. The price was wonderful and this screen is actually a lot better made than the original. It just feels heavier and so far we have had no issues whatsoever.
Better build quality than screen provided with dryer originally. OEM screens lint seal came  loose within a dozen cycles, after two dozen or more cycles this screen is performing as it should.

This was to replace the original filter that came with the dryer. The felt around the edge of the filter was pulling off and could not be shoved back in. This filter fits perfectly and is at least as good as the original (when it was new) at catching lint.
summary: Great fit,perhaps better than the original

reviewText: Better design than the one that came with my dryer, but still failed in the same place as the original one.  Had to reglue the felt after two uses.  Used high temp glue this time and hasn't failed yet since.  Tried to return, but would have had to pay shipping to return.  Poor quality product.
summary: Better design than original but not by much

reviewText: So far so good.  Shelf has not cracked like the original one did.  Seems to be made of thicker/better plastic.
FANTASTIC!! Got here on time and WASN'T BROKEN OR CRACKED!! I was very impressed!
summary: Exactly what I needed and perfect!

reviewText: It seems really expensive for a sheet of glass and some plastic, but it is what it's supposed to be
summary: It seems really expensive for a sheet of glass and ...

reviewText: I have been searching for a replacement for some time now, after my research was done, this was the cheapest one that I found. Received today, and it was the perfect fit. Still unsure why something that is so cheaply made, is so expensive. Not worth all this money, but we needed it.

ITS OK, but nothing extraordinary, just glass/plastic item.  This should be metal/glass some thing stronger for this price.
Plastic? should cost $ 20.00 that's it.
So far is working until it brake again, cause is plastic.
------  I don't know where is the mind or brain of those who design this kind of refrige shelf .
Fit perfectly in the fridge. Glad they still made shelves for it.

reviewText: Good replacement for my freezer. Was tricky finding the right size screw and tapping threads in the unthreaded holes.
We ordered it and it worked!
Replacement Worked Out Fine
Worked exactly as advertised. Got the right one fist time
great! plug and play
Fixed my refrigerator for almost nothing using this.
Fit and works perfectly.
Better than my originals and sturdier .....
Way cheaper than Home Depot or Lowes. Works perfect

I have to admit, I was worried about buying these. I have a pretty old apartment sized Tappan. These are universal, but it's always a concern for something that heats up and could be dangerous. But these work perfectly! They actually lay flat in my stove as well (something the original burners didn't do). The coils are all flat and even. They heat evenly as well. I never thought I would be excited about burners, hahaha! You do have to turn them on and let them heat up a bit before you use them. There is something on them that has to burn off. It's not a lot, and it doesn't smoke like crazy or anything, but it would be a good idea to open a window or turn on the fan. I bought 2 first, to replace burners that went out. I didn't want to order the whole set until I knew they would work with my stove. So I got my last 2 today. They all look and work great!
summary: Nice, even burners. Work great even in an older stove.

reviewText: I have a Frigidaire refrigerator that did not cool down and so I suspected that one of the three components went bad.  This is one of the component that I purchased.  In short, this was the component that broke down and it did fix my fridge.  The package came in on time and packed very well.  All the components needed to replace the old one is there.  Overall, excellent delivery and works good so far for a few months now.
Great product, I would by from this seller again.
Came fast! Fit perfectly into my Frigidaire stove top! Long over due on my part but only because I didn't want to spend $25 + at home improvement stores.
summary: Came fast! Fit perfectly into my Frigidaire stove top ...

reviewText: Happy with price and performance.  Much better price than Sears offered. Glad I sent for it. and that's enough said.

One of the elements worked and one did not.  Seller offered to replace non working item.  Because I am a senior and could no remove the element once installed.  I could not do so.  So, fifty percent was great.

Was not a perfect match for my Kenmore range. Element and wiring was identical, but the two clips screw holes did not match original burner. Now the installed burner if off center from the cook top ring.
summary: Was not a perfect match for my Kenmore range

reviewText: Works with older knob with flat edge, perfectly!
Has the larger opening if you purchased the cheaper one with the small opening. Same look with larger opening. Success.

reviewText: does not fit right. i gave them the model number. they said it was oem for a tappen cooktop well it when on but didn't go all the way down uselell
I needed an extra shelf in the fridge, didn't want to pay too much - so this was good enough

First of all please note that the item being sold here is NOT a "Genuine replacement part" as specified on their description, and the brand is NOT "Whirlpool" also as specified.  This has been noted by other reviewers.  This is a cheap Made in China knockoff replacement part - probably the reason why it is a low quality item, also as noted by other reviewers.  The cheap plastic housing came broken, exposing its interior.  This has been a huge a hassle and a waste of time and money.  Now I may need to go through the hassle of packing this back and take it to the post office or UPS location to return it.
summary: NOT a "Genuine Part", Not made by "Whirpool" - Just a cheap "Made in China" knockoff replacement part.

reviewText: The RIGHT item delivered FAST at a GOOD price. You can't ask for more than that! It was MUCH easier to install than I thought saving me a bunch of money not having to pay a repairman to install it.

This item "by whirlpool", sold and shipped by Amazon works perfectly.  The product I ordered arrived in a box with a Whirlpool label, so it appears to be manufactured for/by Whirlpool.  It took just a few hours to begin making ice.

Installation difficulty appears to be different across different model fridges.  In my case with a Sears fridge, the ice maker mounts across the back of the fridge and I had some problems releasing the electrical connector.  Once I removed the metal shield where the ice maker mounts, it gave me more room to maneuver the ice maker to gain easier access to the connector and was a breeze.

I don't know why some people leaving reviews claim to receive off brand ice makers rather than the Whirlpool labeled one I receive, unless the reviews are mixed with other models.  The model I received and am reviewing is listed as "by Whirlpool" and "Ships from and sold by Amazon.com."
summary: This item "by whirlpool", sold and shipped by Amazon ...

reviewText: Worked perfect. Replaced my old one in 10 minutes
Works better than the original.
Great so far. Put it in and away we went! Great service too!
10 mins to install and seems to work well.  It is a bit loud.  For the price, it seems worth it.
summary: Loud but works well and easy to install

reviewText: I have now been using this replacement icemaker for a couple months and it is working flawlessly. It was easy to install and continue to make solid ice cubes without fail. The shutoff bail work fine so ice is always there but the bin does not spill over.

Love it.  The only issue is trying to notch out the tab, the tab that allows the fill tube to rest in the fill area of the ice maker...that was a little bit of a challenge (as you are working to finish the job in under 20 minutes so your food does not un-freeze).

However, for $36 bucks (shipping included) you can fix a major inconvenience (no ice) in less than 20 minutes.

That is value.

The ice maker was not a complete unit, good thing I still had the old one. I needed to use the old wiring harness and the end cover. I knew this going in, but still, these things should be sold as a complete item.

this is the 3rd icemaker that I had to install.
easy to install but longevity is questioned
does not seem to last long
Complete replacement install took about 15 min., and I am slow! Reconnecting the electrical harness in the frig back was a little difficult because my view was obstructed by a vent.

Its ridiculas how long I went without an Icemaker in my fridge because my original one was broken. I replaced the old one with the new one in about 10 minutes and it works perfect. If you need pictures/video instructions on how to do it yourself go on You Tube and watch several people replace their own.
summary: Replacement ice maker tray FIX IT YOURSELF

reviewText: Broke in three months. The part is a referb not new. Spend the money on a good part. It's worth it.
summary: I know why its cheap! Referb part.

reviewText: This is a good product at a GREAT PRICE!  It fit exactly, with no additional configuring or "engineering".  Works great.
I bought this for my girlfriend, she had been struggling with her current icemaker. it was easy to remove and install.
This model worked like a plug and play for my refrigerator, just remember to take off the existing hardware attachments off your old ice maker and put it on your new one.

Great replacement product. Pretty much plug & play. Had ice in 2 hours. The instructions said "If the
old harness will not work use the one supplied in the kit". Fortunately mine worked because there was
not one in the kit. If yours has a harness hard wired to it you better order a different ice maker.
Otherwise this one works great.
I installed the ice-maker with little difficulty.  Everything fit fine.  I now have ample ice and am very happy with the setup.

It arrived about three days before it was even expected with regular shipping. I removed the old one from the freezer. Replaced the wiring harness. Cleaned it up and had it installed in about 10 minutes time.  It was very easy and my ice works again.  Thanks!

took me a long time to find this for a replacement for a cracked original plastic piece from a different disposal.  Fits and the price was right. However, the rubber guard that fits in the throat is just slightly to small, so it falls in the machine.  I'll probably put some JB Weld on the original plastic flange and put it back in.  Keep this as a back-up.
Wonderful quick transaction with vendor, however.
What can you say about an item like this?  It seems to be working as designed.  I'm super excited that it's not leaking!
summary: What can you say about an item like this? It seems to be working as designed

reviewText: Did not fit my Samsung Dishwasher.
summary: Did not fit my Samsung Dishwasher.

reviewText: So far this dishwasher is great - it gets the dishes very clean even on light setting.  Not the quietest dishwasher, but the size is good and you can fit a lot for the 18" width - we got it for a weekend cabin and the only thing I need to figure out is how to drain/winterize.  The only complaint that I have is that sometimes that bottom rack comes off the tracks - it may be because we haven't attached it to the counter yet though.  Highly recommend if you need an 18".
summary: So far this dishwasher is great - it gets the dishes very clean even on ...

reviewText: I keep this freezer in my art studio.  I freeze my oil painting pallets between painting sessions.  It' keeps my pallets frozen perfectly, however, some of the bottom shelf taken up by motor parts, and also the inside of the freezer gets a thick layer of frost.  It's old-school technology, but suits my needs just fine.  The lock on the door is useless.  I threw away the key.
summary: Perfect for my needs in the art studio

reviewText:
Update Jan 2017:
I had to downgrade my review to 1 star. After having the regulator and the ignitor replaced, I'm now having to have the whole touchscreen replaced (which would have cost me $500 if they hadn't extended my warranty) because the Gas Lock keeps getting stuck. As in it won't fully turn on, and thus I cannot turn it off unless I keep holding the button and switching to Cancel for 5-10 minutes. Anyway, now my back two burners won't light. They are emitting gas, as I'm able to light with a lighter, but won't light on their own. I'm still so bummed because the unit itself looks so nice and I really like having the center large burner and double ovens! GRR!
--
Yikes. I've had nothing but trouble with my unit ever since I got it last May (2015). I've had at least 5 services calls, and two parts replaced. Unfortunately, GE customer service leaves a lot to be desired, and left me scrambling and frantically calling for a part replacement before my at-home wedding last September. First the ignitor was bad, leading to a slow ignite and flames coming out from the oven, then the burners needed to be adjusted, now the regulator is bad and I cannot use the Gas Lockout. For the price paid this is incredibly frustrating.

Aesthetically it is wonderful. And when it does work, it's great! I love the double oven feature and all of the burner space. I just wish it would work more often!
this is the best stove i have ever used.i love the double oven and i love to cook on it.
They're compactor trash bags, what can I say.  They fit in our compactor and hold trash.
Great quality, great price!

I must say I'm impressed with these bags and the price!  I have a Sears compactor and have usually bought Sears bags, until they got to be $2.00/bag which I felt absurd.  These fit the compactor well enough and do the job!
Great bags hold s a lot of weight..doesn't leak...but I don't put wet garbage we compost.

I think these work great. Not as thick as Kenmore bags that came with the house/compactor. The packaging is slightly different on this last order and comparing the bags the new ones are slightly smaller, but not enough to affect the fit in my GE compactall. The new ones also state the paper is recycled. Only have had one slightly leak in the first pack of 12 which I feel might be a bit my fault as it was a low garbage month and I used it for nearly 2 weeks. Will continue to order as long as price remains reasonable.
5 stars all the way! They never leak & I love them!
summary: They never leak & I love them!

reviewText: Fit perfect. Will be buying more
Very tough product.  Wish I would have found this years ago.  Never use those cheap plastic bags again.
summary: The only bag i will ever ue from this point forward

reviewText: these bags don't break and that great
have bought these a few times now.  They work, but seem to be slightly different in size each time i get them.  Good enough.
summary: they work, quality control isn't great

reviewText: They delivered it on time and it fits well.
Just as described. Thanks.

This dryer lasted a little over a year.  If you buy it definitely buy the warranty to go with it because it will not last long enough for you to get your money's worth.  While it was working it was fine, it got the job done but when it broke it broke beyond repair.
summary: Ok while it lasts but doesn't last long

reviewText: Efficient unit, very compact and quiet. Great for RV or apartment use.

If you have alot of time in your hands go ahead and buy this, it takes alot of time at least 3x the normal.  Sometimes the auto and timed dry does not make any sense.  Sometimes there is heat and sometimes there is NO heat, so what I found out is to switch it to timed or auto whichever gives out heat at that time.

I was replacing an element from a hot plate -- saving $5 by ordering the part and not a new hot plate. I'd seen this listed as the "universal" element -- which this seller didn't, and good for him/her, because it's not QUITE universal. It heats just fine. The problem was the bending of the leads, which the images on this product do not show. They are all from the top, straight down, so you can see the coils. But when you look at it from the side, you can see that it has dimension -- the coils that form the cooking surface are about an inch above the leads. So far, no problem. But in my original, both leads bent upward at the same place, next to each other, and on this one, they don't. As shown in the image supplied, the left element goes forward and inch or two, bends 90 degrees, goes straight up another 1" (invisible in the picture, 'cause it's coming right at you) then bends 90 degrees to the left and begins the clockwise coil. With THIS element, unlike my original, the right lead goes about 3" before it has the 90-degree bends. This means that the two leads bend down from the surface level about 2" apart. This would be fine except that my drip pan's holes for the leads did not accommodate that bend. At all. And the material is pretty well unbendable (a good thing, probably), so you can't bend IT to fit. So I bought a pair of tinsnips and cut my drip pan and made it fit. It's a bit ugly, but it works now. $21 later... oh well. Here are some images of other elements so you can (sort of) see the geometry:Whirlpool Stove 8-inch Surface Burner Element 9761345 / 8053268 Range Stove Top Surface 8" Burner Element 316442300  None Ers30m1 Ge (r) Range Surface Elements (6") Judging from the other replacement range elements available, my old one is the weird version, not this one, so I still rate it high. But I do advise purchasers to check all three dimensions before selecting their item. And I remove 1 star because the little metal piece holding the two leads together is not adjustable, whereas it was held together by a screw on my old one, and I like that better for getting it in and out of the drip pan hole (was holes).

reviewText: After one month of using this refrigerator, it began to loose cooling.  We read the manual that instructed us to unplug the unit and open it up and leave it for 24 hours.  We did so and then plugged it in again.  After 24 hours it was cold again so we reloaded the beverages and all was well for 1 week.  Then it started to loose cooling again.  I called Edgestar Warranty department where I got the worst Customer Service representative who claimed he was the manager.  Truly, never in 35 years have I experienced a person who literally did not know what customer service is.  He told me to move the unit "3-4 inches out of its cubby" and to make sure none of the holes on the shelves were covered.  Their are two whole rows of holes per shelf.  When looking at the picture of the frig this means that two rows per shelf can not have anything on them - thus it is not 148 can frig!!!!  Further, we have beer bottles in ours so we could only use two of the shelves so their is even more airflow in ours!  So basically you have to have the refrigerator sticking out 3-4" from the rest of your kitchen cabinets and you have to put about 18% fewer beverages in it than is advertised.  We will give this a shot and report back.
summary: I called Edgestar Warranty department where I got the worst Customer Service representative who claimed he was the manager

Don't buy this part, just clean out the area around the lint screen. First off, I LOVE my LG washer and dryer. I did however have the same issues as others where the lint trap no longer fit flush in the compartment and I had clothes getting caught and damaged. I thought the screen itself had become warped after being in the dryer so I was going to attempt to buy another one. After reading some great reviews here (Thanks all!) i grabbed a velvet hanger (thinking it will grab lint), removed the screen and gently cleaned the area at the bottom of the lint trap housing. Someone else mentioned disassembling the unit, which seems smart, but this worked well too. I pulled out about a softball size amount of lint! I also found a vacuum cleaner hose with a crevice tool worked well too as I could get it down into the area and vacuumed out even more after manual probing. Just clean your unit, don't buy parts! :) Good to probably clean this out once a year or sol. :)
summary: Don't buy this part, just clean out the area around the lint screen!

reviewText: Nina is Amazing, she is a life saver for me. I recently bought the Wonderwash machine (another life saver from laundry alternative), and because I have arthritis since age 15 and am now 49, the wringing the clothes was difficult for me. I have many allergies to detergents and fabric softeners, which is why I wash my clothes in the Wonderwash in my bathtub. Now I can wash and spin dry my clothes in the comfort of my apartment, and no longer need to take Benadryl on laundry days or from wearing clothes washed in other peoples detergents. Nina really works very well and gets a lot of water out of the clothes, by the cups full, as being unable to wring the clothes properly, Nina takes care of this for me, now laundry days are actually fun and healthier for me. It takes anywhere from 2 to 3 hours to dry the clothes if they have thick elastics or thicker clothing, and the towel really come out quite almost dry.

reviewText:
I've owned this dryer for a few months.  Overall it works great, it pulls about a gallon of water out of a large towel that was just washed.  It can, however be very difficult getting your clothes placed inside so that when it spins, it is balanced.  In general I try to only use it with a few items at a time to prevent excessive wobbling.  Sometimes I will have identical items of clothing placed inside perfectly spaced so you would think it's balanced, but it will wobble and automatically shut off.

It's hard to know where the "heavy side" of your clothing is so you can shift some of the clothes from the heavy side to a lighter side to get it balanced.  It might only take moving one item a quarter of an inch to the left or to the right to get it balanced.  You might have to adjust the clothes inside many times to get balanced enough to run.  If you run it while it is not balanced perfectly it makes a clicking noise.  The manufacturer states the life of the dryer will be reduced if it is run while unbalanced too often, so I put extra time in trying to get it close to perfectly balanced.

After all it is physics, if it's not balanced it will wobble, you can't blame anyone for that.  Overall, I would rather use this dryer than go out to the Laundromat so I give it 4 stars.  Since it uses no heat, you should expect to hang your clothes up for at least 4 hours. Clothing like jeans will still take about 12-24 hours to fully dry.
summary: Nice spin dryer, be prepared for trial and error while using it.

The freezer appears to be cold enough and I'm testing the time to make ice cubes.  The bottom level took several hours to feel cold so I would say that this is not a fridge good for raw meats unless you're putting them in the freezer. It is good for storage of drinks, sauces, vegetables and any overage from your primary fridge. The motor runs very quiet. For any fridge that is under $500 with this capacity, I would rate this as good value.  Just hope that it doesn't break after the one year warranty.

reviewText: fast shipping and great product

Ok, I've got a kenmore elite front loading washer.  I bought it at Sears which I'll never do again.  Overall, I love the washer.  However, when I first bought it I was a bachelor.  I had no idea what "HE detergent" was and I used regular washing detergent and within a couple years I fried my first pump.  Sears told me that even though I had bought a service contract they would not honor it because I had used non HE detergent even though no where in the instructions did it say that I had to.  They were going to charge me $300 to replace the pump.  I bought my first replacement (for $40ish with postage) and put it in myself in about 20 minutes.  From that day on I used nothing but HE detergent and a few years later the pump went again.  When I went to buy a new pump I was told that they had a replacement pump.  Considering that i had fried two I thought that made sense.  The new model had a different plug and I cut off the old one and wired on the new one according to instructions provided.  This is very important because when I went to install this pump it had the old plug and I couldn't install it.  Why the 5 stars?  I don't think my issues were the fault of the pumps.  My review is mainly just a warning, make sure of all the electronics and fittings before you purchase or hire a plumber.  I hope if you buy it that it works out for you and thanks for taking the time to read my review.

I purchased this for my Whirlpool Duet He washing machine, which is 11 years old. I replaced my bad drain pump with this a few days ago and have done several loads of laundry since. So far, it's worked just fine. This is not OEM, but looks and works like just it (except the one I got was green in color). The unit I received has the motor, impeller, and "drain trap" assembly, so it's a complete unit. Installation took about ten minutes. Being aftermarket I don't know how long it will hold up, but so far so good and hopefully it will last at least a few years. I assume it is made in China, but nothing was indicated so I can't say for sure. This seller shipped fast, and it arrived quite a bit earlier than expected plus the price was the best around. Overall very satisfied.

UPDATE 1/12/14

It's been just under five months and this part has totally failed. The impeller looks like it's sheared from is shaft, or whatever it would be called. The plastic looks like it's been torn up and is detached from the rest of the part. There is also a black rubber semi circular piece that's in there, which I can't figure out the reason for as the OEM didn't have it. In any case, this thing worked great for five months and now is completely useless to the tune of ~$90. I consider that unacceptable and the only reason I downgraded to three stars and not less is because I was able to find a replacement and that it worked.
OEM quality! Fit right, works well and it appears it will last.

The lint filter on my Maytag dryer model # LDE512 cracked completely through on the left side (after the screen tore in two places).

Maytag wants just under thirty dollars for this part (before shipping), and even third-party parts websites average from 12-24 dollars (before shipping).

Checked here, and lo! This is a compatible replacement for this model number (among many others).
It arrived quickly, adequately packaged.

Putting it into the filter screen slot, it went in fine 4/5 of the way and stopped! As though it were too wide at the top. D'oh!! Not wanting to force it/break it, I removed it. And cursed.
And went to my local parts store, where they assured me they had the correct replacement, for 12.99. Bought one, thinking it looked suspiciously similar. But what do I know,right. Alas - same part. Cursed again.

Then it occurred to me that a) I might have been wrong before, and b) now I had two, so what could it matter if I broke one?

Walked back to the laundry room with the orginal replacement, from Amazon, in hand. Crammed it in there, and when it 'stuck', pushed harder. And it went right in. Sigh.
So now I have two, which is all right, I guess. And now I know that I could trust this seller to start with, and the product was great all along.

I cannot say whether the replacement will hold up better than the original. It IS an exact replica,except for the color, with the same type of thin,poorly attached 'fabric' mesh and very thin plastic framing along the sides. This IS NOT a flaw of this seller's product, but rather a poor design on Maytag's part. Perhaps buy more than one..

If yours is broken, this is a fine replacement.

The pump I received appears to work quite well.  However, it wasn't the pump that I ordered.

After waiting the stated 4 weeks for delivery (with 2-day Prime shipping), I received pump 13708600 instead of 13708000.  The one I received has the outlet of the pump on the opposite side.  I didn't want to wait another month or more to get the correct part so I made do.  However, I am not happy about it.

I managed to re-route the drain hose down the other side of the machine, but I am worried that it is now too close to the shock absorber (a moving part) and may eventually be damaged.  This also meant that there was very little room to reach the pump mounts to tighten the bolts down, since the drain hose and wiring harness now share the 3" between the pump and the side wall of the washer, directly where the mount sits.

Note that this was ordered as being sold by Amazon, but was drop shipped by a company in Texas.  As such I put very little blame on Amazon for this mix up.  However, I was extremely disappointed since I ordered this particular pump after reading reviews on other sellers saying they received the wrong pump.

reviewText: Perfect replacement, but paid > $25 for this.  Seems overly expensive, but we needed it and had no other options

Perfect fit for Sears/Kenmore range.  Both Bake and Broil didn't work on a 10-year old range (top burners worked).  Replaced both oven coils first, but the problem was resolved with the Oven Control board.  The replacement job took 1/2 an hour....make sure to unplug the cord from the outlet before removing the rear cover (240V).  Swapped the wires one by one from the old Control board to the new one, removed 4 screws, removed the old overlay, installed the original overlay on the new Control board, installed new Control board with 4 screws, then rear panel, plug-in the cord and tested the oven.  The oven works like a new one.  Thanks for the reviews.  They helped to diagnose the problem.

My Samsung washer stopped draining completely (got an "nD" error code) and a quick web search suggested pump issues. I took the back off of the washer and removed the pump to find a nice chunk of metal stuck in there. The metal had actually worn away the impeller blades and hence the poor drainage.

This pump is a perfect OEM replacement. Install was super easy: 2 screws for the back cover, 3 screws holding the pump to the frame, two hose clamps, and one electrical connection. Replacement took maybe 15 minutes start to finish.

Two tips: 1 ) make sure you have lots of towels under the hoses and around the washer. If it is not draining, once you release the hose clamps, all that water comes out. It is not a ton but having towels to catch it makes cleanup a lot easier and 2) place a towel or rag over the opening on the back of the washer. It is just stamped sheet metal and is rather sharp. I got a couple of "paper cut" like wounds that would have been avoided if I'd covered the edge of the opening.

In the end, this was a very simple DIY project hat probably saved $200-300 over calling a repair service. Go for it.

reviewText:
First off, I love the compact side by side concept. That being said, the manufacturer has a SERIOUS quality control issue. The 100 plus pound item arrived in a very skimpy cardboard box with VERY little packaging material (thin Styrofoam on the edges only). When I went to open it I tilted the box to one side and heard screws or bolts rattling in the housing. When I removed it from the cheap cardboard box, there was a dent on almost  EVERY panel. Not just small ones, but Quarter sized and larger. Thinking that wouldn't be the end of the world, I proceeded to forgive the bad packaging and was hopeful that the product would be good. Well, when I opened the doors, BOTH of them fell off. It appears as if the hinge pin which pivots the top part of the doors are too short. Being the eternal optimist, I opted to remove the top panel ( 2 simple screws to hold it down) to see if I could fix it. Well it was then when I was convinced that  it needed to be returned because ALL 3 of the screws used to bolt the metal panel where the pivots recess into were stripped out when it was manufactured, which means it NEVER worked properly and left the factory like this!!!! Oh-- I did find out what the rattling was in the housing, there were 2 nuts just floating in the housing which I could not find a home for.

I really wanted this to work, but all the odds were against me. Bottom line, VERY POOR quality control, and equally poor packaging. What a Shame!
summary: SOME OF THE WORST QUALITY CONTROL I HAVE EVER SEEN!!!

reviewText: Always have ice now. Love the ease of use

I got this Ice Maker as a gift for my boyfriend. I was hoping the cubes were going to be smaller, but they are still a good size. The "small" is just a thinner piece of ice compared the the "large" which are thicker pieces. We had a party and realized we weren't going to have enough ice for drinks, so I started making some. Within an hour, I had roughly a full gallon-sized bag of ice cube for drinks! Bonus: The machine is quiet too!
Some tips: as the ice is in the process of making, constantly remove the ice cubes as they drop in the catch-tray. This is not a storage vessel, but just a catch, and if you don't empty this often enough, the ice will begin to melt. I dumped the ice into a gallon size bag and placed in the freezer in between runs. Since the ice is still wet, it will stick together, but with a slight tap on the counter, it easily breaks apart!
This ice is also really great to chew on!!
I highly recommend this product. No, it's not as small as a traditional "rabbit poop" or "hospital ice", but it's not bad either. If you are looking specifically for either of those, this is not it. I still recommend it though!
