reviewText:
Review is about RCA Portable Electronic Ice Maker.

Model No: RIC-102-RED....Appears to be identical to Igloo & other labeled 102 ice makers.
Importer and shipper:  Curtis International Imports, Toronto, Ontario, Canada, made in China

Item was shipped in original store shelf box as I neglected to specify plain brown box. Small ding from handling but with no visible damage nor apparent functioning.  The form fitting styrofoam packing protected it well.

WARNING
The user manual contains several warnings that should have been printed on the outside of the box, IMO. (Paraphrased)

1.  Ice maker should not be tilted more than 45 during transport or use.  Do not turn upside down.  (probably best not to turn upside down while unpackaging)
Allow 2 hours for cooling fluids to settle before use.  A youtube video by a seller suggests 24 hr rest after shipment.

2.  Needs dry level stable surface.

3.  Leave 8" clearence all around for ventilation and component cooling

4.  Do not use hot water, room temperature or lower.

Package should have supplied warning notice on film bag about careful removal of clear packing tape on ice basket, ice scoop, and mechanical ice shovel.  As all interior components are white the tape is hard to see.  Interior space was a bit cramped.  Best to check nothing is left taped down to impede functioning with small flashlight.

Tested the unit to see if it worked.

Room temp 64F,  water temp 62F

Filled about an inch below max water line, which is indicated by very slightly raised lettering and dashed line, very difficult to see even with flashlight.  Fortunately the line is about a finger width below the breaking slope line of the container, readily visible.

From plug in time to first drop of ice bullets was timed at 7m 20sec with another 22 seconds before the ice shovel pushed the ice into the basket.  Harvest was 9 bullets about 3/4" diameter and 1 1/8" inches long on the large setting.  Continued test for four cycles with approx same time.

I'm happy with the results, performs as advertised and at a very good price, less than $100.  And the Candy Apple red color is way hot.

;>)

reviewText: Shipped quick, priced right..

With a somewhat large family, the fridge takes a pounding, constantly being used and abused.  I have been trying to make our fridge last just a little longer because it runs perfectly but our drawers and shelves were getting so "used" looking.  One shelf started getting a crack in it and we actually duct taped it!! lol
So we've been living with an embarrassingly overused refrigerator with duct taped shelves and I would absolutely cringe when guests would come over and see the eyesore! then one day I saw replacement drawers and shelves and thought I would give it a shot.  All I needed was the model number of the fridge and measured the existing shelf just to be sure.  This shelf was so easy to slide into the door and I could finally throw out the ugly duct taped shelf! I plan to replace the drawers next.  This saved us a whole lot of extra moola not having to replace our fridge quite yet. Yay!

I have no idea what model my Kenmore is, just purchased my first home and this thing came with it. Rest assured their parts are universal for both Whirlpool and Kenmore. When I received my bin Wednesday it was a little stiff but fit perfectly and surprisingly it has thicker more sturdy plastic than the original. Bottom line: Definitely by from Free_Shipping_LLC, and don't worry if you have a Kenmore. If it looks like the right shape, it will fit!

reviewText: Works great!  No problems.

Perfect Fit for my Kenmore Elite side by side -- and about 40% cheaper than any other on line appliance parts seller. I love Amazon !  There are apparently several different ways to access the motor depending on the exact model and age of your unit--some can be accessed from a small panel inside the freezer door, some (like mine) must be accessed from the outside of the door after removing the ice and water dispensers--very easy--basically 2 screws. Youtube has some helpful videos--the whole job (not including researching and watching the videos) took less than 20 minutes.

We had gone without the use of crushed ice for several months.  It is hard to find a repair person where we live and the one or two we did find wanted an enormous amount of money just to look at the freezer. My husband and adult son studied the manual and decided to try to repair the problem.  We took a chance and ordered this drive motor.  They installed it in just a few minutes. They dumped out all the old ice and then added back a few cubes to see if it would work.  I was so excited when I heard the crusher start working and it has been doing fine since.  By the way, I read online that this hard plastic piece only lasts a few years for most ice makers. Remember that our only problem was that it would not dispense the ice (the bin stayed full of cubes that we would remove by hand).  If the dispensing is your only problem, most people could install this product easily.
Serves it purpose as portable freezer for keeping medicine readily available at the right temperature. Thank you Amazon for offering this product!
summary: Serves it purpose as portable freezer for keeping medicince readily available at the right temperature.

reviewText: Shipped on time and works great.  We keep it as an extra, general-purpose freezer in a spare room; the freezer seems quiet enough and guests who have slept in the room do not complain.  It freezes food perfectly and adds freezer capacity to our household.  It is lightweight so I (a guy) unplug it once a month and carry it out to defrost in the garage over a drain for a few hours.  The internal area has a removable metal rack dividing the space in two.  If you have a large item, you can easily remove the divider.  However, the bottom area of the freezer is slightly smaller than the top due to the motor taking up some space in the bottom back. I like the lock feature on this "medical" freezer, but I do not have a real need for it, although maybe I'll be a jerk and keep the wife and kids away from my favorite ice cream!
JUST WHAT I WANTED

So, we went a different route with a beverage fridge instead of a wine fridge. WOW, this is so much better. reviewText:
I was really nervous about what condition this would arrive in...  So to contrast with the poor reviews tied to shipping damage--  My unit was really packaged well-- double boxed, hard rubber inserts in base corners, custom cut styrofoam to protect all corners.  Heavier duty cardboard on top and bottom of unit.  Protection for glass door.  I used to work for UPS and we would have considered the current packaging sufficient--  I'm not sure how much more they could do here without shipping on a pallet and charging way more.

Product:  Nice looking, colder option than Frigidaire, NewAir, GE around this price...  I want cool drinks not a wine chiller.  I liked that it has a handle, glass door.  Fan is nice too as some other units indicated inconsistent cooling but the fan equalizes the cool air.

Mine has a minor scratch on the door (top) that only i would notice-- it was under the protective film so I assume it was already there.  A bit of a bummer but again, being picky here.

LED light is on or off all the time.  Will update if anything breaks, otherwise 5 stars.

Take a good look at the packaging when you get it and don't forget to let it sit for 4 hours to acclimate.

This refrigerator is great.  We have ordered two of them.  They both arrived quickly and packaged well.  The LED light is a cool feature.  The racks are moveable so that you can adjust them to fit whatever you are keeping cool.  This looks great in my outdoor kitchen.
summary: This refrigerator is great. We have ordered two of them

The Wonder Washer appears cheaply made, but works fairly well if you follow the instructions and not overload the machine. It augments my regular washer nicely, washing small loads and delicate items well. On the debit side, the washer's design precludes having a bottom drain plug on the wash basket; a drain plug would have been useful for more effective rinsing of the washed items. The manufacturer also should have included a hose that attaches to a faucet so the wash basket can fill up quickly.

Ok I have this and a laundry alternative spin dryer. I can wash a pair of pants, 2 workshirts, some under wear and socks in 1 load. Washes in about 15 mins- tho you can set it for less time. The spin dryer goes for 5 minutes  I and boom your done,, just hang stuff up and it's  a dry in a couple hours :) synthetic dries faster, like just  under an hour. I find that my clothes are still kinda dirty after laundry mat wash and this lil machine frankly gets stuff cleaner...like, here's a great example:
I had a white t-shirt with graphics on it that I washed at laundry mat. All I did was sleep in it, so didn't really get it dirty. But I had some white socks and underwear to wash, too, so I threw them in with just this shirt...was just 2 pairs of socks and 1 pair of under wear...again, all stuff I slept in only once. When I washed them, all this gross grey colored water came out of these clothes...has not used any soap, just a touch of oxiclean in the wonder washer. I rinsed my clothes 3 times, cuz apparently the oxi clean broke loose laundry soap dinge and build up. Stuff came out noticeably whiter once the water ran clear, and I am a believer in this lil machine!
I constantly use it now to stay ahead of the laundry piling up,and save laundry mat trips now for doing towels and bigger things at won't fit.
A good note is to not overfill this machine, cuz it rinses clothes better if you don't. I run it on a wash cycle, then put my shower head in and rinse a couple times til the water runs clear :) I love that I'm done in 20 mins between a wash and a spin dryer and only have to hang things up. It's a lot faster than waiting an hour and plus for the washer at the laundry mat. No line no waiting no quarters. I figure this and the spin dryer paid for themselves in under 6 months with just 2 of us :)
I did crack the lid near where the handle is on the bucket, but it doesn't seem to be a big deal, everything is still working great and not leaking :)
If you over fill it, it will splash a little on the floor so don't over fill past the line. Also, I put mine in a corner to make sure it doesn't tip or spill, cuz if you get it out of balance a little, it splashes a little bit too.i run mine in the bathroom of our RV and if the one breaks I'm buying another one cuz it's such a great help!
summary: Saves me money, time, and clothes are cleaner!

reviewText: Hmm, sounded good and I like it okay.  Would definitely do in a pinch for use in my RV. It is not plummed (only plug & go) so impossible to have a rinse cycle like some reviews complained about. It is portable after all. Works great for us. Is plastic so lightweight & could be fragile I guess. We travel with it in our camper & it does just fine.

reviewText: My apartment did not allow washing machines or dryers. The WW saved me. It will not replace a tradition washer but it will help. I've had it for over a year and I love it. You can at least put 5 clothing items per wash. (No jeans or towels)

It takes a little longer to wash because you need to wash than drain the water and hand wring the items and do a rinse cycle(so 2 cycles for each load.  If you are patience and have the time to wring out clothes it works like a charm, clothes come out very clean and fresh.

This is a toy for kids not a washing machine.  It tries to fall over every chance it gets.  I leaks no matter how much or little I put in.  I does nothing for stains.  Its just a waste of money.  Dont buy this.
summary: Useless waste of money and time

reviewText: Easy to use & does a good job. Also, it is not real loud, which is a plus. I'm glad I bought it.

I won't restate what so many other dead-on reviews have stated, so I will just note the highlights of my experience.

- When I opened it I thought I had ordered an industrial-sized frozen Margarita maker by mistake. Which this is, without a freezing element or a spigot.

- I was AMAZED by the capacity. I did more than a dozen pair of white tube socks in a load. I washed jeans and underwear and a few tanks in a load. Granted, I'm only a size 28 pant, so judge accordingly, but I was afraid one pair would be the whole overloaded-load.

- The lid does not stay on. The "locking" mechanism is just sliding it around until it stops in place. Nothing holds it there. And...

- It walks all over the room unless you tuck it in a corner. I found it would NEVER work on a counter top so, in the bathroom, tucked between wall and pedestal sink with a towel on the the floor before it, it did just fine.

- The motion of the machine -- the canister does NOT "lock" onto the base as directions indicate -- WITHOUT FAIL will loosen the lid, which as I said previously, does not lock, per se.

- YOU MUST observe the max fill line. Even thought there's PLENTY of extra room up top, centrifugal action spins the water right up to the top and it will leak out if it's more than indicated.

- You will need to do a rinse cycle. Dump the water, refill, dump that, refill and then run it for another short cycle. This is the time to add your fabric softener.

- The lid, when pouring, will buckle just from the weight of the water and laundry. Be prepared to hold it in place or to pick laundry out of whatever receptacle you're emptying the water into.

I LOVE THIS PRODUCT AND USE IT EVERY FEW DAYS. Though I haven't tried it for the Margaritas yet...

reviewText: I bought this to felt hand knit items and it works very nicely. It seems to be a well made product. I had no problem with the top (it needs to be turned so the tabs fit under the slots to lock it closed). I'm happy with my purchase.

First things first:  Knobs that are for use on a kitchen range shouldn't use a plastic that will soften and deform when exposed to the temperatures they'll encounter on the front of a range, such as when the oven door is open while you baste a turkey.  These aren't made of high-temp plastic, so they do just that.
Secondly, the metallic rings that have the settings printed on them don't stick down on the knob worth a darn.  The adhesive isn't up to it, and the shape of the ring doesn't match the shape of the knob very well, so they want to pop off almost immediately.
Thirdly, the inserts need to be glued into the knobs, or they won't stay, and I had to do some filing inside the shaft hole to even get them to fit an ordinary Kenmore's controls.

Bottom line is, I wasted my money, and my time, and ended up going out and buying the more expensive, 'original equipment' type knobs I should have paid for in the first place.
summary: If you like knobs that soften and deform when used on a kitchen range, then these are definitely for you.

Great little washer, but a bit labor intensive having to switch laundry from the wash cycle tub to the spin cycle tub between wash & spin & rinse & spin cycles. Further, the hoses are way too short, so I have to use a bucket to fill & empty the wash/spin/rinse cycles. However, it does seem to be sound mechanically & does get the clothes clean. It just reminds me of Mom's labor intensive wash day experiences of my early childhood. Don't expect to get caught up with a back log of dirty laundry unless you're highly motivated. Better to use this for small loads.

its a wonderful machine it washes  as good as a regular washer, my advice would be to make sure you get the insurance which is a couple of dollars more, because the hoses on the machine are kinda flimsy and they get holes in them easy. The insurance will pay for parts you need fixed or a replacement machine.

For the most part it does a decent job. Don't use too much soap. You're better off filling it with a bucket or a detachable shower head and let it sit in the bath tub. Personally I found that flipping laundry back and forth is a pain in the arse, but it works. I started just leaving it in the main basin and putting it through 2 or 3 rinse cycles and then the spin dry. The spin dryer is smaller than the wash load so... ya know, do your own thing. It doesn't collect lint well. I saw someone else mentioned using a fish net to try and snag it, but I haven't tried it yet. Lint doesn't bother me too much, I just shake the clothes out, hang them in a closet and turn a space heater on to speed things up(it's winter here). All in all, if it makes it through 100 cycles, it's about the same as paying for laundromat services for 30 wash and dries.

I just love the washer with spin dryer. It certainly beats carting loads of laundry to the laundromat each week up and down stairs! I live in an apt where there are no washers and dryers so this is a pleasure to have! I do a few small loads was week, whether it be a couple pair of jeans, or shirts or sheets. The spin dryer gets alot of the water out of the clothes so all I do us hang them over clothes bars for the night and they are completely dry! If they are wrinkled at all I just use a wrinkle release spray on them and they are fine. Uses minimal detergent and softener. Love it!!

reviewText: Love this dishwasher! I've used it several times and no issues at all

I read a ton of reviews to determine whether or not to buy this item.  After washing dishes by hand for two years I decided to buy it regardless of what the few low reviews said.  I'm glad I did buy it!  Every problem that was mentioned in the review was mentioned in the manual.  If the hoses leak, the hose was incorrectly installed OR it was started with water that was not within the temperature margin recommended by manufacturer (130 - 149 degrees F).

It even gives a chart on how much soap you should use depending on how hard your water is.  After following the manual, including how to load the dishes - I have not had a problem with it.  Is it perfect - no.  It is not a standard dishwasher available with all the amenities but it does clean the dishes.  I would recommend this dishwasher to anyone that didn't have room for a regular dishwasher.

I received this washer 3 weeks ago.  I'm and old biddy but I can lift 50 lbs.  This thing is a big square carton that the ups man end over ended into my kitchen right in front of the door.  I cut open the box and tried to lift it but could not  get a good hold of it.  My fingers got wet gripping the bottom of the appliance but the box was not wet.  I decided to ignor the fact that there must have been water in the machine.

I had to wait for help to lift it off the floor.  It was only a couple days that I couldn't walk through the kitchen because of the spread of cut open boxes.  I knew going in that it was 3/4" too tall for my countertop.  I had it put on my cuttingboard "island" but that turned out to be top heavy and unstable.  I found a shelving unit at a thrift store and thought it would be a nice project (I was still opitmistic).....I glued and clamped and sanded and stained and added casters and a new top.  Every step of that project fought with me as much as possible.  I got that done, had the dishwasher moved over to its new home, rolled it to the sink and found that the faucet adapter didn't fit my faucet.

There is a set of 3 adapters on amazon to make that right.  Many reviews said it solved just my problem.  I even paid extra postage to get it here faster, since  by this time I was anxious to use my new toy/helper.  None of the adapters worked.  I could not feel or see any threads on the faucet.  I opted to get a new faucet.

My son came from out of town and installed the new faucet for me.  It was fine last night.  Today after his departure, a leak developed.  I could wait no longer.  I hooked up the dishwasher hoses and fired it up (after throwing towels down in the cupboard and on the floor.)  It ran through the "light" cycle without a hitch. It does not make a lot of noise.  It seems sturdy.  My dishes are clean.  Much of the excitement of my new appliance has ebbed with the string of problems, but if it continues to work and after the plumber leaves, I'm sure in a year I will love having it.
It cleans dishes very well, even without rinsing them beforehand. It was also very easy to hook-up and takes up only slightly more room than the dish rack it replaced on my countertop does.

reviewText: I bought those filters for my Honeywell HCM-6009 Cool Moisture Console Humidifier. The original HW filter replacement costs 14.98$ at the time of this review (Honeywell HC-14V1 Replacement Wicking Humidifier Filter, Filter E) for one filter while this did product cost 20.99$ for x2 filters (so a 9$ saving over the cost of 2 x OEM part). How does it perform? Bottom line is that I think it is a great replacement and I do no see a difference in performance. A few things to remember: - before use, and because it is pressed flat, wet it and place it in the groove as designed - once a week, flip it upside down (same recommendation for any filter - it will make the wear even) - I recommend adding this product (Holmes Humidifier Bacteriostat, H1709PDQ-U) to the water - cheap and goes along way (I still have the bottle I purchased 2 years ago and it is far from being over). This will avoid mold forming and te only thing that will wear your filters is hard water. The EOM filter lasted forever for me (3 months with proper care as indicated above and it made the winter/dry season). I have been using this for only 2 weeks now but will post later if there is a longevity problem (some customer did tend to indicate problems with the reinforced aluminum mesh oxidizing and/or the filter disintegrating but just like the original part, I have not seen any of this happening yet).
summary: Doing the job and lower cost that EOM parts

reviewText: Well I am also a newbie to the whole kegerator and really only did air pressurized kegs once or twice.  I research the heck out of any major purchase and this wasn't any different.  I had some reservations about what I read about the temperature controls of this kegerator but I liked the reviews on Amazon, Edgestar, and related forums, so I pulled the trigger.  The package tracking wasn't what I was used to with Amazon Prime and I didn't realize it but free 2-day shipping wasn't an option.  I believe I ordered this on a Saturday and it arrived on a Wednesday evening.  Overall I am really pleased.  In my research I found that alot of people had issues with foaming, I also knew that the main product I would I would be using would be 1/6 kegs with retail hard cider products.  I found a lot of info on self brewing cider but not a lot on retail ciders (particularly recommended regulated CO2 pressure and temperatures for product itself.  I asked my retailer about pressure and he didn't really know.  So anyway here is what all I purchased and how it turned out.  I got this Kegerator, Kegerator Tower Cooler, Beer line Neoprene Coupling Washers, Kegerator Cleaning Kit, and Taylor 5924 Food Service Classic Series Freezer-Refrigerator Thermometer (which hasn't arrived yet).  The cooling tower on this kegerator is lightly insulated with thin styrofoam (which seems adequate) similar to what you would see in packaging.  As I stated before I also purchased a tower cooler right off the bat.  Assembly was failrly simple with use of videos on youtube.  I experienced no leaks in CO2 lines that I know of at this point.  I se the temp on roughly 2 on the control and my retailer chilled the the Angry Orchard 1/6th keg prior to me picking it up.  I put the keg in the kegerator after getting it home and let it sit untapped for about 3 hours.  I then tapped it and set the regulator at about 13.5psi.  One note I would like to have seen a high pressure gauge on the regulator to show the pressure on the bottle to allow you to know how full your CO2 bottle is.  I  tried to remove the plug for the high pressure side and seems like it is "locktite"d or something so rather than mess up the regulator I just tightened it back up and let it be.  First pour was perfect as were the rest.  Haven't tried any other beer.  I would recommend this product to anyone considering an inexpensive kegerator.
summary: I had some reservations about what I read about the temperature controls of this kegerator but I liked the reviews on Amazon

reviewText: Ive been using it as my regular washing machine.  In fact it sits on top of my regular broken washer and drains right into the washing machine drain in the wall.  I'm doing a load as I type.  it's a little noisy and i like to keep an eye on things.  You can throw in a load and then leave the house.  But I'm very pleased.  It gets things clean and I like using natural products, vinegar, Dr. Bronners, etc.  I do find that I prefer to rinse in the washer side instead of the spin side.  I just find it easier.  I drain and then refill and then wash again for a few minutes, then i drain and place load into the spin side.  sometimes it takes two spin loads ;to equal one load of wash.  So i spin half the wash load and then throw it in the dryer.  and then do the rest.  Its a great little machine.  I didn't have $500 or $1000 to spend on getting my machine repaired or buying another, so this is an awesome solution until I have the money.  and as previous posts state, ignore the skinny plastic tube and the instructions.  I put water into the washer via the old washing machine hoses.  I place the hose inside and turn on the water and fill it that way.  I've read that some people use a bucket.  It works great.  make sure dial is on normal and not drain, turn the other dial to the time you need for agitation and voila!  you are washing.  When you are ready, turn dial to drain and then place wet clothes into the spinner.  and then turn dial to the time you need for spinning.  and then you are done.  Again rinsing is your choice whether you rinse in the washer side or the spinner side.

reviewText:
This is a little work horse..... it works well but one must have patience.... it is not an automatic that most are used to.
Some of the reviews cracked me up..... one said it washed her clothes well but did not really dry them..... it is not supposed to dry them...... a spin dryer is nothing more and the spin cycle of an automatic washer...... it requires a two step process.
One person wrote that after a spin cycle he had to tip the machine over on it side and turn upside down to get the water out..... if the drain hose is laid out in the bottom of the shower or bathtub...... it should drain on its own.
Only spin small amount of washed clothes at a time and they should come out from 50% dry to 90% dry depending on the type and weight of the fabric. I wear under armor briefs and they come out 95% dry...... one pair of jeans still 40 to 50 % wet.
Even if I wear it out in one year it is worth going out to get a new one.
The convenience of not dragging it out to the laundry mat @ $30 a trip makes this a little jewel!!!!
LOVE IT THUS FAR AFTER 30 days of use!!!!!!!!!

reviewText:
I recently moved from a huge house with a large washer and gas dryer to a very small but very cute little apartment that was built in the 1800s. Since its just me, I thought this machine would be great.  I did a lot of research before purchasing.
This little machine has been a godsend.  I watched a LOT of videos on how to use it and Im glad I did because I was READY.

1. The instructions are hilariously awful.  At one point it says to spin the Revolution. I was like.. say what? Watch the videos. Its a pretty simple process.
2.  The intake hose is useless. It doesnt fit any faucet known to mankind. You will either have to buy an adaptor but my solution was to set it up next to my standing shower and use my shower head. When I first got it I used a bucket of water. Works fantastic.
3. You need to put this machine upright to drain it properly. There is no pump to drain the water out. It uses gravity.  I use two long wood boxes I have turned upside down and it works great.
4.  You will find that your clothes actually FEEL cleaner. For some reason maybe its the agitator is better, but my clothes smell and seem cleaner and fresher.
5.  Ok so LOTS of people run their clothes with a cycle with soap and then drain and then just put it in the spinner. Thats kinda gross, guys. To do a rinse cycle you just drain the tub and refill it and run a little 6 min cycle to drain the dirty wash water off of your clothes. Thats why rinse cycles exist.

Honestly you guys.. this thing is a 100 bucks DELIVERED to you.  It works. Its a simple design, which I actually prefer because its less electronic crap to go wrong. For not having to go to the laundromat or to my moms house for 4 hours while she inspects my clothes and comments on my underwear.. its great. I wish they had these when I was living in NY. Would have saved me MANY trips up my 4th floor walkup with a laundry bag and a granny cart.
not fully described on the app....
summary: the drain hose is very short, the drain pump doesnt really pump water out unless the hose is totally horizontal ..

reviewText:
Tip! Keep the Styrofoam that comes in the box to help stabilize it.
I can't say enough good things about this washer! It fits so much more than you would think. Just looking at it, you would think it'd only fit a couple shirts, but I have fit queen size fitted sheet, sheet, 6 pillow cases, and a large, thick, quilted waterproof cover into the washing portion. I spin the waterproof cover by itself then fit everything else into the spin the second time. It is so simple to use and you can do laundry very quickly. The spinner makes the clothes basically dry. I have actually worn clothes that have come out of the spinner before.
Love this little guy. The spinner is the best. it gets so much moisture out. I run my towels through the spinner twice just to be on the safe side, then let them air dry the rest of the way

Wow! So happy I bought this! While it looks kind of like a toy (ala easy bake oven haha), it is anything but a toy! I cannot use public laundry facilities due to chemicals, detergents, and dryer sheets etc., so I got this to use in my living space/artist studio. I made an adapter (see videos on Amazon from users who show you how to do it) to hook it on to the water hose in my shower, and then I put it on chairs to drain the grey water into my bathtub using the gravity type of drain. I can't tell you how this has save me and my health issues! The load capacity is about half or less that of a normal washer, but that's okay for me. The motor is powerful and spins the cloths almost dry before I hang them on a clothes rack to dry. (My next purchase might be a small portable dryer to go with this washer). For the price ($100 when I bought it) you cannot go wrong! The only thing I cannot wash is large blankets or bedding or large heavy towels. I can wash bed sheets and regular bath towels just fine. It has a variable timer for wash and spin, but it is not based on actual time, it is numbered 1 through 15 (i.e.: it is not actually fifteen minutes, but I've never timed the cycle lengths). I HIGHLY recommend this little lightweight washer to use in dorm rooms, apartments or for anyone who suffers from multiple chemical sensitivities or similar illness and wants to be able to do laundry in a small space. It is so lightweight I can lift it up and down from chairs. (I while eventually get a rack on wheels that I can set it on and roll to and from the bathroom.) I suggest watching the customer review videos for more information.

Im in love with this little machine. I live in an apartment building with one coin-op washer and dryer for everyone. This is the perfect solution to my public-laundry woes.
Pros:
-Its compact and fits into a small space in my small bathroom.
-The gravity drainage system means I can place the drain tube in my shower without moving the unit. Because there isna slight lift into the shower, the tube doesnt empty entirely, but it isn't enough of an issue to concern me.
-This only requires a standard electric outlet to operate. There is no extra wiring or plumbing needed to set it up and operate it.
-The wash capacity is pretty impressive for a portable machine. I can fit nearly as much into it as the apartment machine Ive used for the past
6 years. You can add items to the wash cycle after its started, so its easy to ensure you're not over-filling.
-It gets your laundry incredibly clean. I included a picture of the water draining after a wash cycle so you could see how much dirt it got out. Embarassing but helpful.
-The spin cycle gets the items so dry! Seriously,
Im surprised every time.
-I can do my laundry without ever leaving my apartment!! This alone makes it worth every penny!

Cons:
-The water hoses for filling the machine are woefully short, and are equipped to hook up to no faucet Ive ever seen.  I may one day purchase longer hoses to allow me to fill the wash tub from my bathroom sink, but in the meantime Ive been using a bucket I fill from the bathtub.
-Its a little labor intensive. Manually fill the wash tub, run a second cycle to rinse, split the wash into two parts to spin, hang everythig to dry. This isn't the kind of washing machine where you can push a button and let it do its thing. It needs babysat, but for me, the work is worth it for the convenience.
-The spin compartment is so much smaller than the wash compartment. I imagine it has to do with  the motor placement, but its taken 3 spin cycles sometimes to finish off the load.
-Its a little noisy. I live on the top floor and am always worried about causing too much noise for the downstairs neighbors. Im going to purchase a mat for this to sit on to absorb the noise, and to keep it from walking across the tile as it agitates and spins.

Ive told so many people about this machine. It isn't perfect, but when you live in an apartment in a big city, you take the conveniences you can get, and this is a HUGE convenience. I highly recommend it!
Super fast shipping. Weight on it is fantastic. Good job guys. The instruction book is a bit primitive, and with good eyes you need a magnifying glass to read what it says. Product itself is great.

How have I not reviewed this yet?  Love it tons.  I've had it for about 3 months now and wash about once to twice a week.
I use it as my dirty clothes hamper, so I just wash when it approaches full.  If I'm not washing pants, I can usually wash 15+ articles of clothing between t-shirts, shorts, and underwear.  And plenty socks.  It'll take 15 minutes of washing, though I usually do 15 more minutes.  Then I spray lots of water in the washing compartment to rinse them out.  Afterwards, most batches take 2 sets of drying to dry.  Get it dry enough that I can put the clothes on a hanger and blow a fan at them and they be dry in a few hours.  When cold in the house, does take until morning.  (assuming I put it on the wash at 9PM and hang them at 10PM and not check on them until I wake up at 6:30 AM).

Love it though.  I've always been terrible about washing clothes, especially when I had to go to a laundromat.  Now I just cart the washer into the shower, fill with hot water, throw detergent in and turn it on.  It's great for lazy people like me as the cycles are so short.  If you forget to take something out, the second cycle still has enough time since it doesn't take long to do its thing.
Greaaaaaaaaat!  Helps me a lot!
This thing is the best thing ever I own 3 and I'm going to buy one more
awesome works incredibly well at getting clothes clean and better than I expected

This machine is the manual transmission of washing machines. Even so, it will change your life. How amazing to do laundry at home after going to the laundromat for years!!

As other reviewers have noted, the hose system has some major flaws. (The hose is actually completely useless.) I was too impatient to go the hardware store for a DIY hose-repair project, and filling the tub with a bucket works just fine.

If you're going to go with the bucket method, I would recommend dumping a full bucket of water on the clothes in the spin tub and then immediately turning on the spinner to rinse. Do that a couple times until the water coming out the bottom is no longer soapy. Rinsing in the wash tub seemed to take too many drain-and-refill cycles. Also, use about a quarter as much soap as you think you'll need. Getting the soap off was the trickiest part of the whole operation.

Some of the questions about the washer express concerns about the lack of a drain pump - I had absolutely no problem. Set the washer in the bathtub and the water drains right out. You don't need a pump.

The capacity is surprisingly large. I found that I could fit about half a regular size load in the wash tub, and about 1/3 of that in the spin tub. The spinner only takes 3-4 minutes, so it's not a terrible inconvenience to split the load up to "dry." Next day edit: I actually washed a queen size comforter in the wash tub. Had to take it downstairs to the community dryer to dry, but washing worked wonderfully.

Final note - you'll need a large clothes drying rack. The clothes come out damp-dry, but they still need a few hours on the drying rack. I originally bought the AmazonBasics Foldable Drying Rack - White, and after one day of laundry I've decided to purchase a more industrial size rack.
Not fit in a apartment.
it works great. I love it. the hose is too short but other than that it helps out a lot.

This portable washing machine is powerful! I wash all my clothing on the gentle cycle. Ive only had the machine a couple weeks but Im amazed at how well it works. It does require more work on my part, but Im glad I don't have to leave my apartment, so its worth the extra work. I fill mine with my detachable shower head, wash, sometimes twice for really dirty loads. Drain (the pump is awesome), refill to rinse, drain again and then put the clothes in spin dryer. I guess most of my loads have been smallish because most of the time I can put the whole load in the spin dryer. The dryer gets so much water out, the clothes air dry in just a couple hours. My biggest complaint is there isn't an effective way to remove pet hair. The lint trap inside the washer is fairly useless. Tumble drying with heat seems like the best way to remove lint and hair. Air drying leaves so much hair on the clothes, some of it can be shaken off when the clothes are dry, but most of it stays behind. Ill probably eventually get a small portable tumble dryer when I can afford one so I can get more lint and hair off my clothes.

summary: Everyone on the floor is coming to me for their ice because they love it.

reviewText:
My refrigerator is not near a water line so making ice must be done with ice cube trays or an ice making machine.  This ice machine reliably cranks out ice for home use.  By no means is this made for commercial use but to fill several glasses of ice for a meal, with more left over, it's great.  I have only used the small setting which seems to fit glasses well.  Of course, you can always bag ice ahead of time and keep it in your freezer for occassions where you'll need a several bags.  The chamber where the ice is kept is insulated but not refrigerated so the ice will eventually melt.  However the water reservoir is below the vented ice basket so the water simply refreezes into more ice.  It comes with a perfectly usable white plastic scoop but I bought a metal scoop because I liked the design.

Pros:
Preforms as advertised.
Quiet except for the occasional sound of ice dropping in the basket.

Cons:
This unit is fairly big and takes up a good bit of kitchen counter real-estate.
While fine for my use, and I would guess most households, it may not produce enough ice for some.
I wish the price were a little lower.
Excellent ice maker

We are very happy with this ice machine! We were like a couple of kids excited over ice!! Lol! It works quickly and is not too loud. It has gotten a little louder than it was in the beginning, but not loud enough to be a bother! No complaints!
It works awesome ! We love it took some time to really start producing. However now we have more ice then we know what to do with !
summary: It works awesome! We love it took some time to really ...

The oven liner works fine. Just have a question about the small,  round piece for a pan. Can this small, round piece be used in an electric toaster
oven?
summary: Happy with oven liner & question about small piece.

reviewText: I bought two of these; one as a gift.  They are flexible and SO easy to clean.  The size is perfect for our oven which is standard.  Having three of the liners to the package is great.  The item can be used on each rack or on the bottom of the oven.  The price is great!

reviewText: I did not read before I bought this that it cannot be used on the bottom of the oven and that is what I wanted them for. So FYI for any of you looking for the same thing. It has to be placed on a rack. I have not used it yet but pie season is here!
summary: I did not read before I bought this that it ...

reviewText: These look fine, and I'm impressed that the box actually contained instructions.... 2 sets actually.  Found out I've been using liners wrong - hopefully these will last a while!!

Arrived as promised and in good condition.  Easy install.  Blue light is great.  Only down side is we've had the unit for about a month and it's yet to get our drinks as cold as I'd expect.  We've got it set on 34 degrees, but our diet cokes don't seem to be as cold as they get in our normal refrigerator.  We bought it specifically to keep drinks extra cold.  I suspect if I got a thermometer and tested the temperature, it would higher than 34 degrees.  But I'm not dissatisfied enough to return it - great price and works good enough.
summary: Arrived as promised and in good condition. Easy install

reviewText: After looking around and reading many reviews to replace our old wine/beverage cooler we decided on this unit. We were looking for one that would cool to 34 degrees (hard to find) with adjustable shelves and modern appearance. This cooler met all requirements and so far is super quiet and keeps the beverages very cold!  I had to call to get a replacement cover for the control panel (sticker that kept coming off) and the service department was very responsive and sent one out the same day I called. So far very pleased with the purchase and totally worth the expense.
Did not work for my stove. The nobs were all wrong.
Did not fit my range.

I LOVE these baskets. I was using so much water handwashing all the pieces to my Dr Brown bottles. This lets me put every small piece in the basket so they don't fall through the dishwasher holes that are in the rack and I can keep it on the top rack instead of the bottle so they don't get too hot. Im not sure if they would morph but now I don't have to find out.
Filters like no other.

My old filter had metal grate, foam, and another grate on the other side. This was just thin metal grates, nothing else. It can't catch or filter anything. At best it would prevent you from touching the fan.
summary: This is a cover not a filter!

reviewText: I purchase this same filter every year - nothing ever changes but the price.  It does a great job.
summary: Just what I needed - will buy again next year.

The oven works great for baking your favorite meals although a couple of the bracket on the back of the range were bent in transit, overall the range itself works really well.

Let's acknowledge the reality that dryer ducting is a pain in the neck. Given that, it's hard to find fault with this dryer periscope. It came packaged well (no dents, etc.) - box within a box within an amazon box. It's relatively easy to adjust to length (measure twice... cut once...). Gloves are recommended since metal edges can be sharp. As other reviewers have noted, you will not get an airtight seal with this thing w/o a bit of investment of your time. Unless you want it to double as a humidifier for the room where the dryer is located, you should anticipate taping it with good quality metal/foil tape (e.g., the 3M/Scotch stuff). This takes a bit of time but is well worth it. The unit comes with two clamps -- a nice touch. Considerations will be different for different "tight spaces" but I found it easiest to install it onto the dryer directly, and then to a short run of collapsible/flexible ducting to allow me to climb out from behind the dryer and then shove it back against the wall.
summary: Does the job, well packaged, ensure you have tape on hand to seal it

This heating element totally works.

But.

It is NOT the most likely thing that will go out on your freezer. Learn from my experience!

If you have a freezer that *isn't freezing*, it is usually because it isn't defrosting. (The frost buildup blocks the airflow past the cooling fins.)
There are two *more likely* things to check and replace before replacing the relatively expensive heating element.

#1  The Defrost Timer ( Frigidaire 297318010 Defrost Timer) is VERY likely to give out eventually. It is just a mechanical timer, so it has a small motor that can go bad or its metal contacts can get fouled by the normal arcing that happens as it switches from refrigerate to defrost mode and back. This is super easy to get to and replace from the back of the freezer. It's about ten to fifteen bucks, so it's a cheap easy fix. (To diagnose, look for the little dial that you can turn. If you turn it, it will click and the freezer should turn off, then turn it just a little more and it should turn back on. If that happens, the contacts are fine. (If it doesn't turn the freezer off and on, then the contacts are fouled - so replace the timer.) If the contacts are fine, next mark a line on the dial and move it to the 12 o'clock position. Wait a few hours and come back and check it. If it is still in the 12 o'clock position, then the motor on the timer is dead, and you need to replace it. If however the timer has turned to, say, 2 o'clock, then the timer is still good and it is very likely that there is a different cause for the freezer to have stopped.

(I had to laugh when our 1960's refrigerator in our lab was freezing up and I quickly diagnosed it as the defrost timer...)

#2  The Thermostat ( Frigidaire 297318010 Defrost Timer ) is located inside the freezer, behind the bottom back panel, near the heat exhanger that looks like a radiator. (On mine, it was at the upper left corner of the heat exchanger.) The thermostat is fairly easy to get to, and you can replace it for about ten bucks. (Especially if it looks bloated or like it came apart at all, just replace it.) To get to it, remove the shelves, and unscrew the panel. Pull the dial for the temperature selector straight off, and unclip the temp selector from the panel. There will likely be a LOT of ice behind it, if you haven't already defrosted the unit.  If you still have to defrost it, unplug the freezer and place a fan inside of it (up on a couple boards to  keep it out of the melting water). Leave the door open and the fan going for a couple hours and the ice will all be gone, easily, except for the water all over the floor... I'd defrost it in the garage, or outside if possible.

#3  This defrost heater / heating element ( Frigidaire 216730700 Defrost Heater for Freezer ) is located under the heat exchanger, and is attached with some thin aluminum strips. It shouldn't really go bad, so I'd try replacing the above two items first. But if they don't fix it... well here's another forty or fifty bucks to throw at fixing the problem. Be careful with the aluminum strips that hold the defrost heater in place, and you can re-use them. (If they break, do NOT use a non-aluminum wire to hold it in place, or you could ruin your freezer!)

Other diagnostics:  (I haven't done these, but they came up in my searches and fixes.)
  If the fan doesn't run inside, that's a fairly obvious thing to replace, and looks to be pretty easy. Be sure to cycle the defrost timer to check it.
  If there is just not enough cooling, but there is no frost buildup and the fan works, then the temperature selector might be the problem.
  If the compressor doesn't run, there is a capacitor that I've seen come up as a replacement part.
  If nothing works at all - no lights, no fan, no compressor, then you might have had a power surge that blew out the computer board.
Works great, an exact replacement part. Very satisfied with this product.

reviewText: I bought this to replace my Best Choice twin tub washer.  It began leaking horribly.  I'm so glad I sprung for a better washer.  It's so worth it.  The hose doesn't attach to the sprayer on my kitchen sink but the unit is high enough where I can hang it into the drum to fill it.  I had to fill my old one with a bucket so this is a huge plus for me.  The drain hose even reaches into my sink I just attach it so it stays with duct tape and it lays against the inside nicely.  The washer runs extremely quiet.  Now for some tips.  If you manually fill with water the best way to wash is with the manual settings.  The programs are hard to time and know when to fill with water and pause etc.  I set my wash to 10 to 15 minutes depending on the type of clothes I'm washing.  I set the rinse to 1 to 2 min and the spin to about 2 min.  If my load is heavy with jeans etc I will run an additional spin cycle from 2 to 5 minutes.  The only time I get water leakage is if my sprayer gets water above the tub and goes on the side area inside the washer, it seems to leak out, just aim the water totally inside the drum and it's good to go.  Since my sink sprayer can lay against the tub I do not have to stand by it the whole time I only check occasionally to see if it's full.  Last hint.  If you are manually filling the washer it will not start if your water level does not match the load you selected.  For instance if you select heavy and the sensor doesn't detect enough water it will not start running.  Just pause the cycle add more water and start again.  On the flip side if you add too much water it will automatically drain until the sensor is happy.  This washer has made my laundry chore a whole lot easier, and no more buckets for filling and draining.  One more thing I do not have the wheels yet but I am able to slightly lift and carry this from one side of the kitchen to the other with no problems and I have a torn rotator cuff in my shoulder.

Just like many other here, I thought I was getting a reinforced screen filter but not a chance! It fit fine so rather than bother returning I went ahead and started using it. Bought this Sept. 2017 and not more than a week after the return window closed in Oct. it ripped on the bottom corner and has now become such a big hole that it is nearly useless! Only two of us that use it and we are not rough when cleaning out the lint.

Why can't someone make a decent filter with reinforced materials?

I purchased this assembly in troubleshooting an ice accumulation problem in my Samsung French Door Refrigerator Ice Maker. Ice was slowly accumulating in the vent just above the fan in the assembly, and the refrigerator failed the self-diagnostic with a 60E error, which pointed to this assembly as a possible failure.

The unit is an exact replacement for the original, and as I discovered when I removed the original, ice accumulation just above the fan had actually stopped the fan from turning. The assembly itself was not really the problem, which didn't really surprise me too much, but I had wanted to be prepared to replace the unit upon dis assembly, if the original turned out to be actually defective. I am still troubleshooting the root cause of the problem, and I now know that neither the ice maker and the Case-fan auger assembly is the problem.  I temporarily externally wired the fan supply and feedback line to monitor power to the fan, and feedback from it and confirmed that the unit is being driven properly, so that isn't the problem either. I'm close to deciding that it is just a bad design by Samsung, and I suspect that many of them fail with ice accumulation in this area, which over time blocks the fan output, and a snowballing ice accumulation that results in failure of the ice maker itself, until the accumulated ice is removed, temporarily fixing the problem . It is an extremely frustrating problem.

I attached an endoscope picture of the vent area where ice accumulates and blocks the fan discharge vent.

 At this point, I'd be delighted to sell Samsung the refrigerator back, but I know that won't happen.
summary: Exact Replacement for the original Samsung assembly

Nice. Didn't include a fuse, though. The switch is rated at 10A @ 125V (6.3A @ 250V), but that shouldn't be a big deal as it seems that's standard for IEC 320 C13/C14 connectors.

I've seen it before, but it really WOULD be nice if the switch lit when on as the translucent red plastic suggests it should. (It doesn't)

The hot side is fused IF you are set up for 125V. The neutral side in this case isn't fused. If you have 250V I presume both sides are hot and that presumably means one of the mains is NOT fused.

However, the switch is DPST, so you can at least switch both hot+neutral / mains.

Construction seems sturdy: terminals appear to be well-staked and none were wobbly. Good fit + finish, imho.

This hasn't failed me yet although I've not had it long. There are no instructions included for wiring diagrams. There are 2 ways to wire this. One way the light on the switch stays on as long as power is supplied regardless if the power switch is on or off. The second way the light only comes on when the switch is powered on.  Go to YouTube for help.

reviewText: It is amazing how quickly it makes ice.

I didn't heed the negative reviews: on paper, this sounded like just the unit I needed, and at a great price. The unit arrived well-packed (maybe the manufacture's listening to all the shipping complaints), I plugged in and waited for 24 hours, per the manual, for the unit to cool down. Then 48, then 72 hours, and nothing happened, even though the lights were on, so clearly receiving power. I called the manufacturer, who offered to send out a repairman, but after ten days, I called again to be told that I was outside the zone of any repairmen, so they would send me a new unit if I put my DOA unit in the dump. Not happy about contributing to landfill, I offered to return it to them at my expense to have them fix it, but they're not equipped to do this. No local charity wanted a broken fridge, so I paid my $40 fee to leave it at the dump, The new unit arrived within a week, and works perfectly. So, in my experience, you have a 50% chance of getting a working unit. If it functions OK, you'll find it's quiet, cools and freezes nicely, and has a deceptive amount of space on the inside. If it weren't for all the drama and forced landfill-filling, I'd be leaving a rave review, but the time, trouble, and cost of getting a satisfactory outcome makes for a two-star review.
summary: Pay attention to the negative reviews!

The gasket came in a timely manner, and is well-made. The best way to install it it to take the door off and lay it flat - it is very easy to do, and it makes the removal and installation of the new gasket a quick and easy job. My freezer door has an ice / water dispenser in it, so I had to disconnect the water line, and that was quite simple. Also - place the new gasket in the tub with some warm water to cover it. This will loosen it up a bit to make installation easier, and also take out some of the "shipping kinks".
I advise you to look at YouTube. There are several very good videos on the installation process worth the time to watch before doing the job. I recommend that you replace the refrigerator door gasket at the same time.
The only disappointment I had was the price! It seems like a lot of money for a piece of rubber gasket, but they gotcha - supply and demand! Lol!
Good luck!

This was a perfect replacement for the too short cable that my oven came with. Probably not for a first time DIY. You'll need to take the back panel of the oven off to get the the electrical connections and then get it back on. I ended up with one screw hole that wouldn't line up perfectly but that's my fault. Removing the old power cable is a bit more difficult as the right angle coupling is held on the over with several internal clips that you'll need to carefully push in with a screw driver before it will pop out. Just make sure that you mark the connections as to proper wire color before removing the old connections and properly tighten the new connections. Assuming you are handy, you shouldn't have too much trouble. If you're purchasing this for your electrician, then you won't have any problems at all.

I bought this after an abysmal experience with the Insignia brand (Best Buy's brand; like Wal-Mart's Sam's Choice), so my expectations were low: be intact, and don't leak compressor fluid after 30 seconds of operation.  In that regard, this thing is great; it was intact, and no oil leakage.

Everything else about it is pretty ok.  At best.  My biggest issue is with the temperature control; the internal thermostat seems to be inaccurate.  I wanted to use this thing to lager the beer I brew, but that requires some pretty precise temperature control (lowered by 1 degree daily, then held at 35 F for a few weeks). According to my random temperature  samples, it's anywhere from 4-8 degrees off-target at any given time.  Granted, this is not a precision instrument, which is why it didn't lose a star. THAT was because the compressor has developed a bit of a whine when it's on.  Given that it's been operating for 2 days....that is not a good thing.

reviewText: keeps my filter from getting all yellow and brown

BACKGROUND- I own a construction company with 10 employees.  We go through ice like water in the summer time, so having a good machine is a requirement.

The other reviews are correct, please avoid this product.  I don't like writing negative reviews, but this one deserves it.  Ordered July 19.  One month later, the machine still produces ice, but about half of what is advertised.  We installed a brand new water filtration device about 2 feet behind the supply line (installed by a licensed general contractor). LOUD.  Installed in our break room at my shop.  The ladies up front have had to close the door to the break room, as the machine is so loud they can't hear the phone.  It claims 40 pounds per day.  IF you dump the load the exact time it fills, you might get 30 pounds a day. If you don't, the ice in the basket will melt, and it starts production all over again.
Once a week, it goes into cleaning cycle.  Hopefully, it doesn't happen Friday night, or it will knock the tray off the spot, and will run water continuously until you reset the machine.  Hundreds of gallons of water will be lost.  It has increased my power bill 30%!!! The only way to stop this, it to shut down the machine, flip the screen over, and restart.  But then, you've got another 6 minutes of reboot time, and loss of at least 5 pounds of ice in that batch. And hopefully you're around when it happens, or it will continue to flush water until you manually shut it down.
Now, it makes good ice, when it does produce.  But, for the amount of money on the machine, the additional power, the lower quantity, it's not worth the money.  I could have purchased 400 bags of ice from a vendor, and still been ahead.
I regret this purchase.  I'm beyond my return time, but from what I've read, it wouldn't matter anyway.
Hopefully, I can convince anyone who takes the time to read this review, and discourage them from this purchase.  We don't have the fault codes, and the machine is on, but I don't have any expectations that it will last through the end of summer. While $520 isn't a huge hit for us, I imagine its a full weeks pay for someone else, and they will be sorely disappointed.
Either save your money for a higher end machine, or continue to buy it from the local gas station.

The wiring connector is slightly different than what was in the Frigidaire. Take pictures of the old wiring before you unhook everything. The labels on the plastic casing of the connector on this burner should match the old setup. You may need to gently pull some on the wires to get enough slack to reach the connections, too. But it did work for mine. All told it took me about 30 minutes to replace. Much cheaper than replacing a stove or paying somebody else to do it.
summary: Wiring connections are not identical to old, but still works.

This little guy does some serious work! I bought this as a gift for my Dad's birthday. We've had no issues with our ice maker. It can sustain 4 people casually drinking from pint glasses for a night of drinking. Don't expect miracle speed out of this machine, but do expect consistent quality and icy drinks!
This is a wonderful icemaker.  It's lovely to look at, makes great ice quickly and it's quiet.

reviewText: It matched my GE fridge perfectly.
Fit perfect and was simple to install

This replacement handle fit perfectly on the fridge door.  The only issue I had with this handle was that the lower edge which touched the fridge was not smooth so did not appear flush with the fridge door once fully installed. It is a minor issue so did not bother with replacing it with another piece.  The instructions were easy to follow.  The button in the middle of the handle works smoothly to open the outer fridge door.  I got the handle to replace the broken button on the original door handle.  It lasted about 4 years.
summary: The instructions were easy to follow
